0.title: International arrivals in India don't need to fill Air Suvidha forms from tonight
0.article_body: In a further relaxation of COVID-19 guidelines for international arrivals in India, the government has ended the rule of mandatorily filling up self-declaration forms on the Air Suvidha portal. The new rule comes into effect on November 22 from 00.01 hours IST onward or Monday midnight. The rule could be reviewed later based on the COVID-19 situation.

1.title: After 'Hera Pheri 3', Firoz to make 'Welcome 3' without Akshay: Report
1.article_body: Producer Firoz Nadiadwala has reportedly decided to make 'Welcome 3' and 'Awara Paagal Deewana 2' without Akshay Kumar. According to a source quoted by Bollywood Hungama, Firoz was "disappointed" after Akshay claimed he opted out of 'Hera Pheri 3' due to creative differences. However, Firoz roped in Kartik Aaryan as Akshay quoted a high price of ₹90 crore, report said.

2.title: Ukraine evacuating civilians from Kherson, Mykolaiv for winter
2.article_body: Ukraine has started evacuating civilians from the recently-liberated areas of the Kherson region and the province of Mykolaiv, officials said on Monday. Authorities believe that the damage to Ukraine's infrastructure will make the upcoming winter unbearable for people in these areas. Residents have been advised to move to central and western parts of Ukraine, said Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk.

3.title: Lighthouse India to sell stake worth ₹320 crore in Nykaa: Reports
3.article_body: Lighthouse India is reportedly planning to sell a stake worth ₹320 crore in FSN E-Commerce Ventures, the owner of Nykaa. The shares would be offered at a price of around ₹183.5 apiece, marking a discount of nearly 2% against the last closing price. The sellers would reportedly offer a total of 1.8 crore shares in the block trade.

4.title: England record their 2nd biggest win in FIFA World Cup history, beat Iran 6-2
4.article_body: England defeated Iran 6-2 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener on Monday, recording their second-biggest win in FIFA World Cup history. Jude Bellingham opened the scoring for England, while Bukayo Saka scored twice, and Raheem Sterling, Marcus Rashford and Jack Grealish scored one goal each. England's biggest win in FIFA World Cup had come against Panama (6-1) in 2018.

5.title: Young fan breaks security cordon at Big B's home, falls to his feet; actor shares pics
5.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan took to his blog to reveal that when he was greeting his fans at his home 'Jalsa' on Sunday, a young fan broke the cordon and rushed to touch his feet. Sharing pictures, Bachchan wrote, "It leaves me in a swell of...aqua when in solitude...what how when why...me!" The fan also gifted a sketch to Bachchan.

6.title: Machine Gun Kelly wears suit covered in inches-long gunmetal spikes; pics viral
6.article_body: American rapper Colson Baker, known professionally as Machine Gun Kelly, wore a purple Dolce & Gabbana suit covered in several inches long spikes made of gunmetal to the American Music Awards. Addressing his outfit choice on the stage, the rapper jokingly said that the suit was "hard to pee in." He won the Favorite Rock Artist award at the event.

7.title: Difference between my parties & other parties is guest list: Ira Khan
7.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan took to Instagram and shared a video from her engagement party. Along with the video, Ira wrote, "The main difference between my parties and other people's parties is the guest list." Aamir, Reena Dutta, Mansoor Khan, Kiran Rao, Imran Khan and actress Fatima Sana Shaikh were among others who attended Ira's engagement party.

8.title: Will fast unto death till govt accepts demands: Farmer leader Dallewal
8.article_body: Bharti Kisan Union (Ekta Sidhupur) President Jagjit Singh Dallewal said he would continue his fast unto death till the Punjab government agreed to the farmers' demands. The farmers are demanding increased compensation for government-acquired land, crop damage and cancellation of cases. Dallewal accused AAP of acting the same way as BJP during the farmers' protest in Delhi.

9.title: Chennai police throw baby shower for constable at police station
9.article_body: Officials of a police station in Chennai organised a baby shower for a seven-month pregnant female constable. The constable was not able to reach her hometown in Tiruvannamalai for a baby shower due to personal reasons. Police officials of the K2 Ayanavaram Police Station also provided free meals to everyone including those who came to file complaints.

10.title: Priest, his wife injured as petrol bomb hurled at him in Rajasthan
10.article_body: An elderly priest and his wife received burn injuries after a group of around eight to 10 people allegedly hurled a petrol bomb at him in Rajasthan's Rajsamand district, officials said on Monday. Deogarh SHO said some of the people allegedly involved in the incident have been rounded up for questioning and the matter is being investigated.

11.title: Kerala govt can't remove me as Chancellor of universities: Guv Khan
11.article_body: Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said the LDF government in Kerala only "works for its cadre". "Universities have to be free of executive interferences, and under-qualified and unqualified will not be appointed," added Khan on the controversy over appointments to state universities. He further said the state government can't remove him as Chancellor of universities, as it is "beyond their power".

12.title: I hope to get exposure of playing in IPL: Joe Root
12.article_body: England batter Joe Root said that he hopes to get exposure of playing in the IPL. "I would certainly debate going into the IPL draw quite seriously...It would be great to get involved," Root said. He added, "The next couple of years, might be a good time to explore playing a little bit more of that format (T20)."

13.title: Tribals stand with BJP today as previous Cong govts did not work: Shah
13.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah said that Gujarat has seen development in every field under BJP. Addressing a rally in Gujarat's Narmada, Shah said, "Previous Congress governments did not work nearly as much in decades as PM Modi [did] for the empowerment of tribals." He added, "This is why our tribal brothers and sisters today stand firmly with the BJP."

14.title: Will screw everyone's happiness if I go back in 'Bigg Boss 16': Gautam
14.article_body: Gautam Vig, who was recently evicted from 'Bigg Boss 16', was asked if he would like to enter the show as a wildcard. "I'll go again as a wildcard because I've seen a lot of things after coming out...I'm gonna screw everyone's happiness if I go back as a wildcard," he stated. Gautam said Shiv Thakare would win the show.

15.title: Lost my voice a day before concert, still managed to perform for 3 hrs: Shreya
15.article_body: Singer Shreya Ghoshal, who's on a USA tour, revealed that she lost her voice "completely" on November 18, after performing in Orlando. "With...prayers of my well-wishers and my doctor Sameer Bhargava's care, I could bring my voice back to be able to sing...full 3-hour concert for...packed New York arena," she added. Shreya performed in New York on November 19.

16.title: Suspended Andaman Labour Commissioner held in gang-rape case
16.article_body:
Suspended Andaman and Nicobar Islands Labour Commissioner RL Rishi was on Monday arrested in connection with the gang-rape of a 21-year-old woman, police said.
So far, three accused have been arrested in the case, including former Andaman and Nicobar Chief Secretary Jitendra Narain and a Port Blair-based businessman. A special investigation team (SIT) has questioned Narain thrice.

17.title: Nursery admissions in Delhi schools to start on December 1
17.article_body: Application process for nursery admissions in private schools in Delhi will begin on December 1, which is two weeks earlier than last year. All private schools will have to upload their admission criteria by November 28. Schools will issue first list of selected candidates and the waiting list on January 20. The second list will be issued on February 2.

18.title: Who are the 10 most-followed people on Instagram as Ronaldo hits 500 mn followers?
18.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo has become the first person to have 500 million followers on Instagram. Lionel Messi is the second most-followed person with 376 million followers. Kylie Jenner comes in next, followed by Selena Gomez, Dwayne Johnson, Ariana Grande, Kim Kardashian, Beyoncé, Khloé Kardashian and Justin Bieber. Virat Kohli is the most-followed Indian on Instagram and 17th worldwide.

19.title: Turkey says 3 killed in Kurdish rocket strikes launched from Syria
19.article_body: Kurdish militants launched rocket strikes on Turkey from Syria on Monday, killing at least three people and wounding 10 others, Turkish officials said. The rockets reportedly struck a school and two houses in the border town of Karkamis, as well as a truck. This comes following Turkey's airstrikes targeting Kurdish militant bases in Syria and Iraq on Saturday and Sunday.

20.title: Indian-origin woman pleads guilty to assaulting, starving house help to death in S'pore
20.article_body: A 64-year-old Indian-origin woman named Prema S Naraynasamy has pleaded guilty to 48 charges of voluntarily causing hurt to her daughter's house helper Piang Ngaih Don. The 24-year-old Myanmarese victim was allegedly kicked, punched, slapped and starved by Prema, resulting in her death. CCTV footage reportedly showed Piang being abused till she died in July 2016.

21.title: I haven't done heartfelt 'Aashiqui' kind of love story: Rakul Preet
21.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, speaking about the films she would like to do in the future, has said that she would like to do a love story. "I haven't done a heartfelt 'Aashiqui' kind of love story that still wrenches my heart," she added. The actress further stated that she also would like to do an "out-and-out" comedy film.

22.title: Toxic gas leaks in cold drink manufacturing unit in WB; several fall ill
22.article_body: Several workers of a cold drink manufacturing unit fell ill after the leakage of toxic gas in West Bengal's Kamalgazi area on Monday. Two firefighters also fell ill during the rescue operation in the area. "Going by the pungent smell of the gas it seems to be ammonia. We have a team of doctors with us," an officer said.

23.title: NCP, Sena protest in Pune against Maha Guv's remarks on Shivaji
23.article_body: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena faction protested in Pune against Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari's remarks on Chhatrapati Shivaji. At a programme, Koshyari called Shivaji an 'old idol' of Maharashtra and said, "You can find new (idols), from Babasaheb Ambedkar to Nitin Gadkari." The protesters demanded that Koshyari be removed as Governor.

24.title: Pune residents ask PMC to open more gym facilities
24.article_body: Residents of Pune have asked the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to increase the number of gymnasium facilities. During the COVID-19 pandemic, PMC shut down all gymnasium facilities and resumed only 34 gyms after March 2022, of which, only 30 are functional. "We don't have any plans of opening separate gyms as of now," said Santosh Varule, Deputy Commissioner Sports, PMC.

25.title: China signs $60 bn LNG deal with Qatar, one of the biggest ever
25.article_body: China has signed a $60 billion agreement for purchases of liquefied natural gas from Qatar. Qatar Energy will send China's Sinopec 4 million tonnes of LNG yearly from 2026, the state-controlled companies announced, making it one of China's biggest imports in terms of volume. The deal will reportedly last for 27 years, making it China's longest LNG supply agreement ever.

26.title: Iran fans boo national anthem, players don't sing it at 2022 FIFA WC in protest
26.article_body: The players of Iran's national football team refused to sing national anthem ahead of their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener against England in Qatar's Doha on Monday. It was in an apparent show of support for anti-government protestors back home. Iran fans also booed the national anthem, with some seen making thumbs-down gestures.

27.title: MP man arrested for sending death threats to Kumar Vishwas
27.article_body: A 39-year-old man has been arrested in Madhya Pradesh's Indore for allegedly sending death-threat emails to poet-politician Kumar Vishwas. The accused had allegedly sent multiple emails to Vishwas over the last few days, Kumar Vishwas' manager said in a police complaint. The man had also allegedly made objectionable comments about Lord Ram.

28.title: Firetruck hit by plane was on planned drill: Lima airport operator
28.article_body: The operator of Peru's Lima airport on Sunday claimed that a firetruck involved in a fatal collision with a passenger plane on Friday had been doing a pre-arranged emergency drill. Lima Airport Partners, the airport operator, said it was coordinating the drill with the air traffic authority. The firetruck had entered the runway for the same drill, it said.

29.title: Industry bodies suggest wider tax base, higher capex at pre-Budget meeting
29.article_body: Industry bodies pitched for widening the tax base, boosting private investments, consumption and employment creation at the first pre-Budget consultation meeting. Saket Dalmia of PHD Chamber of Commerce and Industry said infrastructure investment must not be less than 10% of the GDP. Confederation of Indian Industry President, Sanjiv Bajaj, suggested increasing capex spending to ₹10 lakh crore.

30.title: Ex-soldier beaten by pantry staff on train in MP after argument over namaz
30.article_body: Retired soldier Vilas Naik was beaten by pantry car staff near Madhya Pradesh's Betul after an argument broke out between them over other passengers offering namaz on the train. Naik had objected to other passengers offering namaz, had begun reciting prayers and had stopped a pantry staff member. He was beaten by staff after pantry car's manager tried to intervene.

31.title: Aishwarya remembers late dad on his birth anniversary, shares post
31.article_body: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan took to Instagram to remember her late father Krishnaraj Rai on his birth anniversary. She shared a picture of herself and daughter Aaradhya as they posed in front of his picture. "Prayers and love in remembrance. Happy birthday dearest darling daddy," Aishwarya captioned the post. Krishnaraj Rai passed away in 2017.

32.title: Woman poses as IAS officer on FB, cheats K'taka man of ₹40 lakh
32.article_body: A 30-year-old Karnataka man was allegedly cheated of ₹40 lakh by a woman who lied about getting selected for the IAS. According to reports, he met the accused on Facebook and transferred money to her as and when she asked. He borrowed ₹32 lakh from colleagues and his father, police said, adding that he also sold a piece of land.

33.title: Chargesheet in DAV school rape case by November end: Hyd Police
33.article_body: The Banjara Hills police said they would file the chargesheet in the DAV school rape case by November-end. Police said they found no evidence in the school's darkroom and hence will rely on the accused's confession. The incident, which took place on October 17, came to light when the 4-year-old complained of pain in her private parts.

34.title: SS Rajamouli meets 'Mission Impossible' director Abrams in LA, fans react
34.article_body: 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli met filmmaker JJ Abrams, who is known for films like 'Star Wars' and 'Mission Impossible III', at the Governors Awards in Los Angeles. The official Twitter account of 'RRR' shared the picture of both directors on the social media platform. Several fans reacted to the picture. One of the users tweeted, "Pride of Indian cinema."

35.title: EaseMyTrip shares jump 20% as it turns ex-date for split, bonus issue
35.article_body: Online travel agency EaseMyTrip's shares surged 20% after they turned ex-date for 3:1 bonus issue, and 1:1 stock split. The board of directors of Easy Trip Planner, which operates EaseMyTrip, announced November 22 as record date for the stock split and bonus issue to "reward shareholders". EaseMyTrip shares hit an intraday high of ₹57.30 apiece.

36.title: Essar completes $2 bn sale of port, assets to Arcelor Mittal Nippon Steel
36.article_body: Essar group said it has concluded the sale of captive ports and power assets to Arcelor Mittal Nippon Steel India for $2.05 billion. With the sale, Essar has completed its asset monetisation programme to effectively become debt free. The sale consisted of infra assets, including a 270 MW power plant and ports at Hazira, Gujarat, and Paradip, Odisha.

37.title: No box office competition between Black Panther 2 & Black Adam: Dwayne
37.article_body:
Actor Dwayne Johnson reacted to a report on Twitter which stated that the box office collection of Marvel's 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever' has surpassed Dwayne's 'Black Adam'. "What a neutral post. 
I love competing...there's no competition with the established global brand of 'Black Panther' compared to 'Black Adam'...who a year ago no one even heard of," he tweeted.

38.title: It was the best I've seen her play: Sathiyan on Manika's Asian Cup bronze
38.article_body: Having watched world number 44 Manika Batra beat some of the higher-ranked players on way to her Asian Cup bronze medal, her mixed doubles partner Sathiyan Gnanasekaran said it was the best he has seen her play. "She's always had the potential to beat...top players in the world...I think she's now starting to play at her best," he added.

39.title: Man kills wife after she refuses to give earrings in Palghar
39.article_body: A man allegedly killed his wife after the latter refused to give her earrings to pay for the rituals of the former's dead mother in Palghar, Maharashtra. The incident happened as the accused's mother had died a few days ago and he had mortgaged his wife's jewellery to conduct the funeral, police said. Notably, the accused is still absconding.

40.title: Jio gets NCLT's approval for acquisition of Reliance Infratel
40.article_body: The NCLT gave its approval to Reliance Jio for the acquisition of Reliance Infratel that owns tower and fibre assets of Reliance Communications. NCLT has asked Jio to deposit ₹3,720 crore in the SBI escrow account to complete the acquisition of the assets. The Committee of Creditors approved the resolution plan by Jio in March 2020 with a 100% vote.

41.title: BJP's sting video claiming AAP sold MCD tickets for money is fake: MLA
41.article_body: AAP MLA Dilip Pandey on Monday said that the sting operation video shared by BJP claiming that the party sold MCD tickets for ₹80 lakh is "fake". The video was purportedly shot by former AAP leader Bindu, from whom the party demanded ₹80 lakh for an MCD ticket, claimed BJP leader Sambit Patra.

42.title: Aiming for more divestments in next 12 to 24 months: Tata Power CEO
42.article_body: Tata Power Chief Executive Officer Praveer Sinha said the company is aiming for more divestments in the next 12 to 24 months after inducting new investors into its renewable energy business. He added that the company is trying to extend the interim arrangement to import coal for its subsidiary Coastal Gujarat Power. The arrangement expires on December 31.

43.title: Tamil Nadu record biggest-ever victory in 50-over cricket history
43.article_body: Tamil Nadu on Monday recorded the biggest-ever victory in List A (50-over) cricket history. Tamil Nadu set the world record by defeating Arunachal Pradesh by 435 runs in a Vijay Hazare Trophy match. The previous record was set by Somerset, who had defeated Devon by 346 runs in 1990.

44.title: Karthik questions format of Vijay Hazare Trophy after TN score 506 runs in 50 overs
44.article_body: Veteran wicketkeeper Dinesh Karthik questioned Vijay Hazare Trophy format after Tamil Nadu put up a total of 506 runs in 50 overs against Arunachal Pradesh. Karthik tweeted, "Does it make sense to have Northeast teams play elite teams in league phase...It just topples run rates of teams and imagine if a match against one of these teams gets rained off!"

45.title: 3 live crude bombs found in primary school premises in West Bengal
45.article_body: Three live crude bombs were seized from the premises of a primary school in Chinsurah in West Bengal's Hooghly district on Monday. Local residents spotted the bombs in the premises of Naldanga Narayanpur Primary School before school hours and informed the police, a senior officer said. "We have...started an investigation on how the bombs reached the school," the officer added.

46.title: Man dies after truck knocks his bike on Mumbai-B'luru highway in Pune
46.article_body: A man was killed after a truck knocked down his two-wheeler on the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway in Pune on Sunday night, a few hours after a major accident caused a 48-car pileup on the same highway. The man was hit by the truck outside a tunnel. Around the same time, another trailer hit three to four vehicles in the area.

47.title: Goldman Sachs cuts India's GDP forecast for 2023 to 5.9%
47.article_body: Goldman Sachs has slashed India's GDP growth forecast for 2023 to 5.9% from an estimated 6.9% this year. Goldman attributed the decrease to higher borrowing costs and fading benefits from the pandemic reopening, according to a Bloomberg report. The firm expects headline retail inflation to ease to 6.1% next year from an estimated 6.8% this year.

48.title: Met PM Modi for 1st time in 2010, he told Dhoni 'Apna ladka hai': Ravindra Jadeja
48.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja recalled the first time he met PM Narendra Modi in 2010. "He was then the Chief Minister of Gujarat. MS Dhoni was our captain. PM Modi told Dhoni, 'Apna ladka hai. Dhyaan rakhna' (He is our boy. Take care of him)," Jadeja said. "It felt really good," Jadeja added.

49.title: Twitter users upload movies, shows after site's copyright system breaks down
49.article_body: Twitter users uploaded full-length movies and shows on the platform after its automated copyright system broke down. A Twitter user uploaded the entire 'Need For Speed' movie in parts in a thread of over 60 tweets, while another uploaded an episode of 'Spongebob Squarepants'.  Twitter displays 'this media cannot be displayed' message when a takedown happens.

50.title: Twitter's head of French operations quits, tweets 'It's over'
50.article_body: Damien Viel, Twitter's head of French operations, has quit the company after the platform's new owner Elon Musk fired several top executives and cut the company's workforce by 50%. "It's over. Pride, honour and mission accomplished," Viel tweeted. "What an adventure!...What encounters! Thank you all for these 7 incredible and intense years," he added.

51.title: Akshay announces The Entertainers tour in North America with Disha, Nora
51.article_body: Akshay Kumar has announced his North America tour called 'The Entertainers'. Taking to Instagram, he wrote, "Are you up for a GIANT PARTY? Gear up, THE ENTERTAINERS are coming your way!!" He will be joined by actresses Disha Patani, Mouni Roy, Nora Fatehi and Sonam Bajwa. The tour is set to begin in March 2023.

52.title: Number of cars increasing in Mumbai, designated parking needed: HC
52.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Monday said that the city needs designated parking spaces because of the increasing number of cars. A division bench of Chief Justice Dipankar Datta and Justice Abhay Ahuja was hearing two pleas seeking the implementation of a comprehensive parking policy to prevent unorganised traffic from causing difficulties for fire engines to approach an affected structure.

53.title: Rohit Shetty gets Pride of India award at Society Achievers Awards
53.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty was given the Pride of India award at the Society Achievers Awards for his contribution towards Indian Entertainment. Taking to Instagram, Rohit wrote, "Privileged to receive the Pride of India Honour." The award ceremony, which was attended by Hema Malini, Farah Khan and Sonu Sood, was held in Mumbai on Sunday.

54.title: Mumbai Police arrest man for attacking father-in-law, relatives
54.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a man for allegedly attacking his father-in-law and brother-in-law with a knife when he heard the duo had allegedly abused his mother. The accused, Adnan Selot (35), also attacked his own 7-year-old son. Police caught Selot in Kolkata and brought him to Mumbai on Saturday while the incident occurred in Vile Parle West last week.

55.title: Jet Airways plans to sell 11 aircraft due to delay in resolution: Report
55.article_body: Jet Airways' lenders may sell 11 aircraft, forcing it into liquidation, due to being frustrated over the delay in execution of the resolution plan, Economic Times reported. The Jalan-Kalrock consortium has failed to pay up despite receiving NCLT's approval, reportedly forcing lenders to reconsider their options. The banks had received six Expressions of Interest for buying the planes in August.

56.title: 6 members of family including 4 children found dead in Rajasthan
56.article_body: The bodies of six members of a family, including four children, were found in a house in a village in Rajasthan's Udaipur. As per reports, police suspect it to be a case of suicide due to financial distress. As per the initial investigation by police, it appears the head of the family allegedly killed everyone and later died by suicide.

57.title: Cocaine worth ₹20 cr meant for festive season seized by NCB Mumbai
57.article_body: Mumbai's Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) busted an international drug trafficking syndicate and seized cocaine worth ₹20 crore, which was meant for the upcoming festive season, reports said. A South African woman was caught at the Mumbai airport, which led to the recovery of 2.8 kg of cocaine. The drug was concealed in two pairs of shoes and two purses.

58.title: 7 students of Bihar govt school faint after inhaling toxic gas
58.article_body: At least seven students of a government school fainted after inhaling toxic gas in Bihar's Madhubani area on Monday. According to reports, the gas was released because of the burning of coal in a nearby coal depot. All the students were rushed to the Sadar Hospital and are now in stable condition, reports added.

59.title: Delhi woman found in suitcase on highway was killed for 'leaving home unannounced'
59.article_body: Delhi woman Ayushi Yadav was killed by her father for leaving for a few days without informing home, her family said. Nitesh Yadav shot his 21-year-old dead in Delhi's Badarpur after she returned from her 'unannounced' outing on November 17. He then packed her body in a trolley bag and threw it on the Yamuna Expressway where it was found.

60.title: N Korea calls UN chief 'a US puppet' for condemning missile test
60.article_body: North Korea's foreign minister called UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres "a puppet of the US" for joining the US-led condemnation of the recent North Korean intercontinental ballistic missile test. "I often take (Guterres) for a member of...US White House or...State Department," Choe Son-hui said. The missile test demonstrated North Korea's capability to strike anywhere in the continental US.

61.title: 7 European captains ditch 'OneLove' armbands at World Cup under FIFA pressure
61.article_body: The captains of England, Wales, Belgium, Netherlands, Switzerland, Germany and Denmark won't wear 'OneLove' armbands at 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar under FIFA's pressure. The associations took the decision after FIFA made it clear to the teams that captains will be booked if they wear the armbands. The Dutch football association said it was "deeply disappointed" in FIFA's stance.

62.title: K'taka Congress MLA shares video of students filling potholes
62.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA Priyank Kharge shared a video of students filling potholes in and around a government school in Mysuru. Captioning the video, Mallikarjun Kharge's son criticised the state government and said, "While the government is busy painting schools saffron, the students are filling up potholes." The priority of the government is to please their masters, he added.

63.title: There's no money or recognition as writers: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' writer
63.article_body: 'Thank God' and 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' writer Aakash Kaushik said that people become directors because "there's no money or due recognition" as writers. "Unfortunately, writers aren't given much importance," he added. The writer, who's been in the film industry for 15 years, also recalled his struggles. "They (people) make you work and don't pay money...happened to me too," he shared.

64.title: 'Drishyam 2' earns ₹64 cr on opening weekend, beats Kartik's 'Bhool...'
64.article_body: Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Drishyam 2' has earned over ₹64 crore at the domestic box office on the opening weekend. The film has beaten Kartik Aaryan's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' which had earned ₹55.96 crore on its opening weekend. Trade analyst Taran Adarsh tweeted, "This one's a SMASH-HIT...Friday: ₹15.38 crore, Saturday: ₹21.59 crore, Sunday: ₹27.17 crore. Total: ₹64.14 crore."

65.title: Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra is a 'yatra' for power: PM Narendra Modi
65.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat polls, PM Narendra Modi criticised the Congress and said that party's Bharat Jodo Yatra is not a 'padayatra' but a 'yatra' for power. "[Congress is] the party of a princely family, and I am from an ordinary family…For Gujarat voters, it is a pro-incumbency government and they do not want to change their...affiliations," said Modi.

66.title: Death toll due to earthquake in Indonesia rises to 56, over 700 injured
66.article_body: The death toll due to the earthquake that hit Indonesia's West Java province on Monday rose to 56, while up to 700 people were reported to be injured, according to officials. The 5.6-magnitude quake struck on land in Cianjur town, about 75 km southeast of the capital, Jakarta, at a depth of 10 km, Indonesia's weather agency said.

67.title: At 35, Djokovic is practising harder than when he was 22: Coach Ivanisevic
67.article_body: Following Novak Djokovic's record-equalling sixth title at ATP Finals, his coach Goran Ivanisevic said the 35-year-old Serbian is practising even harder than when he was 22. "That's why he's still so good and...he's still going to be even better. The will to practise...improve...to be better is amazing," he stated. Djokovic is the oldest champion in history of the tournament.

68.title: PM Modi to distribute 71,000 appointment letters at Rozgar Mela tomorrow
68.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will hand out 71,000 appointment letters to newly inducted recruits tomorrow as part of the Rozgar Mela. The vacant posts of teachers, lecturers, nursing officers, nurses, doctors, radiographers, pharmacists, and other technical and paramedical posts would be filled. "The Rozgar Mela is expected to act as a catalyst [for] further employment generation," said a government release.

69.title: Pak defence ministry recommends 5 names to succeed Bajwa: Report
69.article_body: Pakistan's Ministry of Defence has recommended five names to the Prime Minister's Office on Monday for the appointment of a new Army chief who will succeed General Qamar Javed Bajwa, a media report said. Bajwa will retire on November 29 after a three-year extension and will not seek another extension. The ministry has suggested names of five top generals.

70.title: Delhi woman whose body was found in suitcase on UP highway was shot dead by father
70.article_body: The 21-year-old woman whose corpse was found in a trolley bag or suitcase on the Yamuna Expressway in UP's Mathura was shot dead by her father in Delhi, multiple reports said quoting police. She has been identified as Ayushi Yadav. Her body was identified by her mother and brother and her father has been arrested.

71.title: Indian Matchmaking 3 is complete, to be announced soon: Sima Taparia
71.article_body: Matchmaker Sima Taparia has confirmed the third season of her OTT show 'Indian Matchmaking'. "You'll see season 3 soon...It's ready completely. It will come out within a few months," she said at an event, which was held recently. Sima added that the streaming platform will soon plan and announce the release date of the web series.

72.title: Kharge meets party workers 1st time after taking charge as Cong chief
72.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday met party workers and members from the public for the first time after he took charge as the party’s chief last month. The meeting took place in New Delhi. Party workers queued up outside the AICC headquarters for the meeting and the new party chief met them in his office one by one.

73.title: BJP’s actions are root cause of distress among farmers, youth in Maha: Rahul
73.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said the BJP’s actions are the root cause of distress among farmers, youth and tribal people in Maharashtra. "The root cause...is the BJP government’s actions, which concentrate wealth and power in the hands of a few. It is worsened by their agenda of dividing Indians against each other using culture, religion, caste and language," Gandhi added.

74.title: Pune Traffic Police to deploy more officials at congestion-prone areas
74.article_body: The Pune Traffic Police will deploy more officials at various junctions reporting traffic congestion in the city and will keep strict attendance for staff deployed on traffic duty. The department has asked traffic officials to update their attendance on the 'My Safe Pune' app. The traffic police will also intensify action against vehicles parked in no-parking zones, the police said.

75.title: DJB waives surcharge on late payment of water bills till Dec 31
75.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board (DJB) has waived the surcharge on water bills' late payment until December 31, 2022. Furthermore, DJB has extended the waiver of 75% up till March 31, 2023. Delhi residents must enter their water connection numbers or the KNO to see their outstanding bills and rebate details. Water bills can be paid using multiple payment options.

76.title: Who has scored the most goals for England in FIFA World Cup history?
76.article_body: FIFA World Cup 1986 Golden Boot-winner Gary Lineker holds the record for scoring the most goals for England in FIFA World Cup history. He scored 10 goals in a total of 12 matches. Lineker is followed by current England captain Harry Kane (six goals) and former player Geoff Hurst (five goals). Michael Owen and Bobby Charlton scored four goals each.

77.title: I am bulletproof, I wear an iron suit: Ronaldo on criticism of his interview
77.article_body: Referring to criticism over his interview with Piers Morgan wherein he spoke against Manchester United, Cristiano Ronaldo said, "I'm bulletproof. I wear an iron suit." He added, "Stop asking my teammates about me. Ask them about...World Cup," he added. Further, talking about timing of the interview, Ronaldo said, "I don't care what other people think...I speak when I want to."

78.title: Can do anything for Masaba, won't do it for husband like I do it for her: Neena
78.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said that she feels she can do anything for her daughter Masaba Gupta. "For my husband, I will do...but I will not do anything for him like I will do for Masaba," she added. "I don't think there is...love between a man and a woman...It starts with lust...If you get along, you become affectionate," she further said.

79.title: It looks like a dream: Rituparna Sengupta on Priyanka's LA home
79.article_body: Actress Rituparna Sengupta recently visited Priyanka Chopra's house in Los Angeles. She took to Instagram to share pictures with Priyanka's singer-husband Nick Jonas and her mother Dr Madhu Chopra. Rituparna thanked Madhu for her hospitality and wrote, "It was lovely to meet you and the Jonas family...the house looks like a dream, made some beautiful memories."

80.title: Children suffer burns to face, chest after science experiment goes wrong at Aus school
80.article_body: At least two students, aged between 10 and 11, suffered serious burns to their face and chest after a science experiment conducted outdoors went wrong at a primary school in Sydney, Australia. Nine others are believed to have suffered superficial burns. The students were reportedly trying to create a "black snake" with baking soda, a sugar mixture and an accelerant.

81.title: UK comedian destroys ₹9.7 lakh over David Beckham's role at Qatar World Cup
81.article_body: British comedian Joe Lycett has shared a video which purportedly shows him shredding £10,000 (₹9.66 lakh) after failing to receive a response from David Beckham over his role as a Qatar World Cup ambassador. Lycett had urged the former footballer to withdraw from his role at the tournament and offered to donate £10,000 to gay charities if he did so.

82.title: Aadhaar not valid proof to determine age under Juvenile Justice Act: Kerala HC
82.article_body: The Aadhaar card isn't recognised by the Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children) Act, 2015 as proof of the date of birth of an accused, the Kerala High Court observed. The court was looking at the bail plea moved by a boy accused of committing rape on a 13-year-old girl after kidnapping her from her mother’s custody.

83.title: Man hurls abuses at Kerala HC Chief Justice Manikumar; arrested
83.article_body: The Kerala Police arrested a man from Kochi for allegedly intercepting Kerala Chief Justice S Manikumar's car and for hurling abuses at him. According to the police, a drunk man jumped in front of his car while he was going to his residence. The accused claimed that he was angry because the car was travelling at a high speed.

84.title: 5 doctors booked for negligence leading to COVID patient's death in Noida
84.article_body: Five doctors of Yatharth Hospital in Noida were booked for alleged negligence in treating a COVID-19 patient which led to his death during the second wave of coronavirus. The patient was in his 20s. His family claimed he was not administered the remdesivir injection in time. The allegations were found to be true by Gautambuddha Nagar's deputy chief medical officer.

85.title: IIM alumnus founded ProcMart raises $10 mn in Series A round
85.article_body: Noida-based B2B procurement startup ProcMart raised $10 million in a Series A funding round led by Sixth Sense Ventures. The funding round comes shortly after IndiaMART subsidiary Tradezeal Online agreed to sell 4,850 equity shares of ProcMart worth ₹13.62 cr to Sixth Sense Ventures. Founded in 2015 by IIM Lucknow alumnus Anish Popli, ProcMart is an enterprise-focused supply chain aggregator.

86.title: Edtech startup Skill-Lync acquires Binny Bansal-backed Crio
86.article_body: Engineering-focused edtech startup Skill-Lync acquired experiential learning platform Crio. Following the acquisition, Crio will operate independently under the Skill-Lync group. Skill-Lync was founded in 2018 and has raised a total of $20 million from investors like Y Combinator and Better Capital. Crio, also founded in 2018, is backed by Binny Bansal and other former Flipkart employees.

87.title: Chinese Coast Guard seizes rocket debris from Philippine Navy
87.article_body: The Chinese Coast Guard forcibly seized a suspected piece of Chinese rocket debris from the possession of Filipino navy personnel in the South China Sea, a Philippine military official said on Monday. A Chinese Coast Guard vessel twice blocked the Philippine naval boat towing the debris, he added. Chinese personnel subsequently cut the "towing line attached to" the Philippine boat.

88.title: I'll be 65 next year, don't want to be active when I'm 80: Actor Gary Oldman
88.article_body: Actor Gary Oldman, who appeared as Jim Gordon in Christopher Nolan's 'Batman' films, revealed that he wants to retire from acting in the near future. "I'm 65 next year, 70 is around the corner...I don't want to be active when I'm 80," he said. "I've had...enviable career...and I do have other things that interest me outside of acting," Gary added.

89.title: Delhi records coldest morning of season so far at 8.9°C
89.article_body: Delhi recorded its coldest morning of the season so far on Monday, as the temperature fell to 8.9 degrees Celsius, while the air quality remained in the 'very poor' category. The previous lowest temperature of the season was recorded on Saturday, which stood at 9 degrees Celsius. Delhi's AQI was 316 at 9:10 am on Monday.

90.title: Water school launched at Hyderabad’s Durgam Cheruvu
90.article_body: A waterboarding school, jointly established by Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA), Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) and The Yacht Club of Hyderabad, was opened in Durgam Cheruvu. The school will train children above eight years in kayaking, sailing, windsurfing and other water sports. Training from Nursery to National, Asian and Olympics levels will be provided here.

91.title: Made 'K3G', 'Brahmastra' but Dharma didn’t get its due credit: Karan
91.article_body: Karan Johar said that Dharma Productions has made different kinds of films but it's not given the due credit. "We made a massive mainstream 'Brahmastra'...made 'Kapoor & Sons'...I've directed 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham'...still I'm asked 'aap kuch alag kab karoge' (when will Dharma do something different)," Karan added. He mentioned that the production house is "always looking for great content".

92.title: Driver turned off ignition to save fuel causing 48-car pileup on Pune highway
92.article_body: The 48-car pileup on the Pune-Bengaluru highway on Sunday night occurred after a truck driver turned off the ignition on a downward slope to save fuel and couldn't apply brakes later, the police said. The driver fled the scene after the truck hit dozens of vehicles, police added. The accident injured around 20-30 people.

93.title: BJP releases video of sting operation, says AAP charging ₹80 lakh for a seat
93.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party on Monday released a video of a sting on Delhi minister Gopal Rai's aides and alleged that the senior Aam Aadmi Party leaders were involved in selling party tickets for money ahead of the upcoming civic polls. The BJP alleged that AAP is charging ₹80 lakh for a seat in the MCD polls.

94.title: NZ Supreme Court rules voting age of 18 is discriminatory
94.article_body: New Zealand's Supreme Court on Monday ruled that the country's current voting age of 18 was discriminatory. It was hearing a petition by a group that seeks the inclusion of 16 & 17-year-olds as eligible voters. The court found that the current voting age was inconsistent with the right that protects citizens against age-based discrimination from the age of 16.

95.title: Manushi Chhillar dating Zerodha Co-founder Nikhil Kamath: Reports
95.article_body: Actress and Miss World 2017 winner Manushi Chhillar is in a relationship with Zerodha Co-founder Nikhil Kamath, according to reports. "The two have been going quite strong. They have even moved in together. Currently, Manushi is focused on her Bollywood career," the reports quoted a source. The two have reportedly been dating each other since 2021.

96.title: India would be one of my top picks for hockey WC: Ex-Netherlands captain Veen
96.article_body: Revealing his favourites for hockey World Cup 2023, ex-Netherlands captain Stephan Veen said, "India would be one of my top picks...Australia as well." He added, "I think India have grown as a team over the last couple of years. They have a home advantage now...But, beware of Netherlands, Germany and Spain." World Cup will be played in Bhubaneswar and Rourkela.

97.title: Mangaluru blast accused was booked in 3 cases, including 2 UAPA cases: Police
97.article_body: The accused in the Mangaluru autorickshaw blast case, Mohammed Shariq, was previously booked in three cases, Karnataka ADGP (Law & Order) Alok Kumar said on Monday. "He has been booked under UAPA in two of the cases and he was wanted in the third case," he added. Two cases were filed in Mangaluru and one in Shivamogga, he said.

98.title: Amit Shah meets Rivaba, Ravindra Jadeja in Gujarat today
98.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah met BJP leader Rivaba Jadeja and her husband, India cricketer Ravindra Jadeja at the airport in Gujarat's Jamnagar before starting today's poll campaign in Gujarat. Rivaba Jadeja is a BJP candidate from the Jamnagar (North) Assembly seat. Rivaba shared the pictures of the meeting with Amit Shah on her Twitter handle.

99.title: Video shows man escaping with cash, jewellery from 2 Ghaziabad events
99.article_body: The police are looking for a man who allegedly walked into two Ghaziabad events and escaped with bags containing cash and jewellery. The first incident took place on November 15, while the other took place four days after. CCTV footage shows the accused covering a bag with his yellow blazer and escaping in one of the incidents.

100.title: Disappointing to see how long it took: Warner on CA amending rules over captaincy ban
100.article_body: Reacting to Cricket Australia announcing amendments in its Code of Conduct policy on Monday, David Warner said it's frustrating to see how long it took to make the changes. "Because we could've done this about nine months ago...I'm not a criminal," stated Warner. With the changes in the policy, Warner can now apply to have his lifetime leadership ban reviewed.

101.title: Ronaldo becomes first person in the world to reach 500 million followers on Instagram
101.article_body: Manchester United and Portugal forward Cristiano Ronaldo has become the first person in the world to reach 500 million followers on Instagram. Ronaldo had reached 400 million followers in February this year and he had reached the 300-million mark in June last year. In January 2020, he had hit 200 million followers on Instagram.

102.title: Will Priyanka demand to sack him?: BJP leader on Cong MLA booked for rape
102.article_body: After Madhya Pradesh Police registered an FIR against Congress MLA Umang Singhar for allegedly raping and mentally harassing a woman, BJP spokesperson Shezad Poonawalla reacted to the matter. "Why is Priyanka Gandhi Ji’s outrage on such issues selective? Will she demand to sack this MLA?" Poonawalla tweeted. "Those who speak of 'ladki hoon' are silent," he added.

103.title: Odisha CM announces ₹2 lakh ex-gratia to kin of those killed in Jajpur mishap
103.article_body: After a goods train derailed at Korai railway station in Odisha's Jajpur, killing at least two people, CM Naveen Patnaik expressed his condolences and announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh for the family members of the deceased and free treatment for the injured. The Centre also announced compensation of ₹5 lakh for the family members of the deceased.

104.title: FIFA World Cup reporter robbed on air, Qatar police ask her how to punish thief
104.article_body: An Argentinian TV reporter was reportedly robbed after she went live on air from the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. Dominique Metzger said she reported the crime to the local police who assured her the thief will be caught, the Mirror reported. She was then asked, "What do you want the justice system to do when we find him?"

105.title: Ghaziabad admin adds 2.5 lakh new voters for upcoming UP local body polls
105.article_body: The Ghaziabad administration has finalised the voters' list for the upcoming local body polls in Uttar Pradesh. The administration has added around 2.5 lakh new voters to the district's final list. A total of nine local bodies, including the Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation (GMC), from the district, will go for polling. Notably, 294 wards are spread across Ghaziabad's nine local bodies.

106.title: I wouldn't recommend any person to work at Twitter: Ex-Twitter executive
106.article_body: Twitter's former Vice President of Global Media Katie Jacobs Stanton tweeted that she would not recommend any person to work at the social media company after it was acquired by Elon Musk. Calling the $44-billion acquisition a "toxic takeover", she wrote, "In a million years, I never thought I would feel this...but I would not recommend...any brand advertise on Twitter."

107.title: Ranveer meets Usain Bolt, Ben Stokes at Abu Dhabi Grand Prix; shares pics
107.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh met several sportspersons at the 2022 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, including England cricketers Ben Stokes, Joe Root and James Anderson. In a series of pictures that he shared on his Instagram Stories, Ranveer can also be seen posing with Usain Bolt, former West Indies cricketer Chris Gayle and Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola.

108.title: Shalin & Tina should've signed TV serial instead of Bigg Boss 16: Adatia
108.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 15' contestant Rajiv Adatia took to Twitter and wrote that the relationship between Shalin Bhanot and Tina Datta in 'Bigg Boss 16' is fake. He added, "Shalin and Tina both should have signed a TV serial rather than BB ('Bigg Boss 16')! Because they're turning BB into a TV serial and are ruining the concept of the show!"

109.title: Pic of Mangaluru auto blast accused posing in ISIS-style with cooker bomb released
109.article_body: Karnataka Police on Monday released a new photo of Mangaluru auto blast accused Mohammed Shariq holding a cooker bomb with circuit wires in 'ISIS style'. The photo was reportedly taken before the auto blast in Mangaluru, which injured the accused and the auto driver on Saturday. Police found explosives at Shariq's residence and said that he worked under multiple handlers.

110.title: She threatened to file false case, wanted ₹10 cr: MP Congress MLA on wife's rape charge
110.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress MLA Umang Singhar, who has been charged with rape and domestic violence, based on a complaint by his wife, said that she had threatened to file a fake case against him and had demanded ₹10 crore. He said that he had filed a police complaint against her for mentally harassing and blackmailing him.

111.title: B'wood doesn't care about #MeToo: Payal on Sajid's 'Bigg Boss' stint
111.article_body: Reacting to Sajid Khan's participation in 'Bigg Boss 16', actress Payal Ghosh said that Bollywood "supports" the accused and doesn't care about the #MeToo movement. "The more controversial you are...you'll be encouraged on such platforms," she said, adding that the makers only care about money. Earlier, Payal alleged that Anurag Kashyap had sexually harassed her in 2013.

112.title: Films like 'RRR', 'KGF: Chapter 1' nailed it, I love those movies: Saif
112.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan has said that South Indian films are doing "enormous numbers" at the box office. He stated that SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' and Yash's 'KGF: Chapter 1' "nailed it", adding that he loved these films. "I loved 'KGF: Chapter 1' particularly, it had that universal thing to it...It is a very confident cinema," the actor said.

113.title: What a fighter, incredible: Swiatek on Djokovic's 6th ATP Finals title
113.article_body: Reacting to Novak Djokovic winning a record-equalling sixth title at ATP Finals, world number one Iga Swiatek tweeted, "What a fighter. Incredible achievement. Congratulations." Ex-Spanish tennis player Alex Corretja said, "Djokovic has played little this year, but almost every time he has played he has triumphed! Absolute machine!" Djokovic beat Norwegian Casper Ruud 7-5, 6-3 in the final.

114.title: BCCI introduces digital payment system for players
114.article_body: The BCCI has introduced a digital interface that will allow players to raise invoices for monthly match fees and allowances from any location. The Database Management System (ODMS) will minimize paperwork that has led to delay in payments to players in the past. "For us players getting match fees on time is a priority," BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said.

115.title: Jumla made, interfaith marriages happen since long: Gehlot on love jihad
115.article_body: While talking about 'love jihad', Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said that a "jumla" has been made. "Inter-caste & interfaith marriages have been taking place for a long time now. But politics is being done on basis of the manner in which one community has been targeted," he added. He also spoke about Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra.

116.title: Addressing child sexual exploitation posts on Twitter no.1 priority: Musk
116.article_body: Twitter owner Elon Musk took to Twitter to say that addressing the issue of child sexual exploitation content on Twitter is his number one priority. He said this in response to a report saying he has started addressing the issue after years of Twitter's "inactivity on the subject under past management".

117.title: K'taka villagers beat BJP MLA, tear his clothes after elephant kills woman
117.article_body: Mudigere BJP MLA MP Kumaraswamy was allegedly beaten and his clothes were torn by residents of a village in Karnataka's Chikkamagaluru district. He visited the village after an elephant killed a woman. The villagers were allegedly angry as Kumaraswamy didn't respond to elephant attacks in the past. The woman was cutting grass when a wild elephant trampled her to death.

118.title: I'd play Messi and drop Ronaldo in 2022 FIFA WC: Wayne Rooney
118.article_body: Ex-Manchester United forward Wayne Rooney, during a discussion on 2022 FIFA World Cup, was asked to name players he'd like to "Play, Bench and Drop" from their respective teams. Rooney was asked to choose among Lionel Messi, Harry Kane and Cristiano Ronaldo. "I would start Messi, bench Kane and drop Ronaldo because he stopped playing for his club," replied Rooney.

119.title: Over 1.32 lakh e-challans issued for number plate rule violation in Hyd
119.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police issued around 1,32,392 e-challans this year to motorists moving around with tampered or unregistered number plates. Out of the total e-challans, 97,756 are of two-wheelers, 31,392 are of four-wheelers and 3,244 are of other vehicles. The Hyderabad Police have taken up special drives against wrong number plates and have also booked 525 persons for the offence.

120.title: PM says Congress insulted him, said 'Modi ko aukat dikha denge'
120.article_body: While addressing a rally in Gujarat on Monday, PM Narendra Modi claimed that Congress had hurled insults at him on several occasions. "They said 'Modi ko aukat dikha denge' (We will show him his place). They called me 'gandi naali ka keeda' (a sewer worm), 'neechi jaati ka' (a person from an inferior caste)," PM Modi added.

121.title: Man robbed by autorickshaw driver, co-passengers in Gurugram
121.article_body: A man was allegedly robbed after boarding an autorickshaw at the Gurugram bus stand. The victim, Umesh Thakur (40), was taken to a secluded place in Dhankot village, where he was allegedly robbed and assaulted by the vehicle's driver and two other co-passengers, police said. The accused snatched Thakur's phone and other belongings before throwing him out of the vehicle.

122.title: Delhi Police to question Aftab Poonawala's ex-colleagues in Mumbai
122.article_body: Delhi Police will be questioning Aftab Poonawala's former colleagues of a five-star hotel in Mumbai where he worked as a trainee chef. Two police officers from the team will question the staff about Aftab, while one officer will carry on the probe in Palghar's Vasai. Aftab has been sent to 5-day police custody for allegedly killing his live-in partner.

123.title: FTX's fall has lessons for entire crypto sector: Ethereum Co-founder
123.article_body: Ethereum Co-founder Vitalik Buterin told Bloomberg that the crypto exchange FTX's fall has lessons for the entire crypto ecosystem. "What happened at FTX was of course a huge tragedy. That said, many in the Ethereum community also see the situation as a validation of things they believed in all along: centralized anything is by default suspect," he added.

124.title: Nearly 20 dead, 300 injured in 5.4 magnitude earthquake in Indonesia
124.article_body:
Around 20 people have been killed and at least 300 injured in an earthquake that rattled Indonesia's main island of Java, officials told AFP. The earthquake had a magnitude of 5.4 and struck near towns south of Jakarta, according to the United States Geological Survey.
In videos shared on social media, buildings could be seen shaking during the earthquake.

125.title: Actress Akshara walks off stage after man throws money at her during live performance
125.article_body: Bhojpuri actress Akshara Singh recently walked off the stage during her live performance after a man came up on stage and threw money at her. A video of the incident shows Akshara getting angry and leaving from the event in Jharkhand where she was singing for her fans. Akshara is yet to issue a statement on the incident.

126.title: Rasna founder Areez Pirojshaw Khambatta passes away aged 85
126.article_body: Rasna Group's founder and Chairman Areez Pirojshaw Khambatta has passed away at the age of 85. In a statement, the group said Khambatta, who was also the Chairman of Areez Khambatta Benevolent Trust and Rasna Foundation, passed away on Saturday. He was also the former Chairman of WAPIZ (World Alliance of Parsi Irani Zarthoshtis).

127.title: 'Taarak Mehta…' actress Munmun Dutta meets with accident in Germany
127.article_body: 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' actress Munmun Dutta shared that she has met with an accident in Germany. Sharing the news on her Instagram Stories, the actress wrote that she has hurt her left knee and will "have to cut" her trip short and "fly back home". Munmun had started her Europe trip almost a week ago.

128.title: Rahul Gandhi stays connected as friends despite political differences: Raut
128.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Monday said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is one such person who stays connected as friends against ideological and political differences. "I've friends in BJP as well...they were happy when I was in jail, this is politics of Mughal era," Raut added. "Rahul called and checked on me yesterday despite his busy schedule," Raut stated.

129.title: Deonar Police send alert about stolen truck, suspects held within 24 hrs
129.article_body: The Deonar Police alerted all India Police about a stolen heavy-duty tipper truck and managed to arrest three suspects in the case within 24 hours, reports said. The suspects were brought to Deonar police station and interrogated. Police said that the market value of such types of trucks is over ₹32 lakhs.

130.title: HMDA to lease over 158-km of Outer Ring Road to private agency: Report
130.article_body: The Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) will reportedly lease more than 158-km of Outer Ring Road (ORR) to a private agency. The duration of the lease will be 30 years, the report added. Hyderabad Growth Corridor Limited (HGCL) has invited applications from interested private entities. The work of the agency will include tolling, operation, management and maintenance of ORR.

131.title: Enormous tragedy, Guj HC to monitor probe: SC on Morbi bridge collapse
131.article_body: SC on Monday directed the Gujarat HC to periodically monitor the probe into the Morbi bridge collapse. "It is an enormous tragedy and this will require weekly monitoring to see...attribution of responsibility for those guilty," a two-judge bench headed by CJI DY Chandrachud said. The SC also allowed petitioners to move HC with pleas seeking independent CBI probe.

132.title: Aftab forced Shraddha to eat non-veg, would beat her if she didn't: Mumbai activist
132.article_body: Aftab Poonawala, who allegedly killed Shraddha Walkar, would force her to eat non-veg and would beat her when she refused, said Mumbai social activist Poonam Bidlani. "Once Shraddha came with bruises on forehead, cheeks, and neck suggesting she was strangled," Bidlani said. She added that Shraddha came to her thrice for help and once they even lodged a police complaint.

133.title: 2 militants escape from court with help of bikers & smoke-screen in B'desh
133.article_body: Two Islamist militants, who were given a death sentence for murdering a Bangladeshi-American blogger and his publisher, escaped from a crowded court in Dhaka on Sunday. Unidentified bikers sprayed some chemicals and created a smoke-screen before taking the convicts with them. "We have launched a massive manhunt to recapture them and their helpers," police said.

134.title: I compromised on my education for trading: Zerodha's billionaire CEO
134.article_body: Stockbroking platform Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath told BQ Prime in an interview that he compromised on his education for stock trading. He also recalled that the Head of Department of his college called his mother several times to complain that he had some problem. "I didn't really do well in college...I didn't spend too much time there," he added.

135.title: AAP's credibility gone down, are they colluding with BJP: Ashok Gehlot
135.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly elections, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot criticised AAP and claimed that the party's credibility has gone down. "Someone should ask Kejriwal, why did they suddenly withdraw [their] campaign from Himachal? They have just propped candidates there. Who knows if they [will] withdraw it here too? Are they colluding with the BJP?" said Gehlot.

136.title: Karnataka CM inaugurates groundnut fair 'Kadalekai Parishe' in B'luru
136.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai inaugurated 'Kadalekai Parishe', a groundnut fair in Bengaluru's Basavanagudi on Sunday. The annual fair is happening after a gap of two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic. In the fair, which is organised in the opposite lane of the Bull temple, the groundnut farmers from Karnataka and nearby states bring bags of groundnuts to sell them.

137.title: Which all suspended Twitter accounts were reinstated after Musk’s takeover?
137.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump’s Twitter account was reinstated after nearly two years. Kanye West's account was also reinstated after it was banned over his antisemitic remarks. Former kickboxer Andrew Tate's account, which was permanently suspended from Twitter in 2017 over his misogynistic remarks, was also restored. A right-wing satirical site, The Babylon Bee's account was also restored.

138.title: Maharashtra CM directs probe into Pune-Bengaluru highway accident
138.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has directed a thorough investigation into the cause of the road accident that took place on the Pune-Bengaluru highway on Sunday evening in which around 48 vehicles were damaged. As soon as the information about this accident was known, instructions were given to the local administration to arrange proper treatment for the injured, CM Shinde tweeted.

139.title: Indian Racing League's main event cancelled in Hyd after accident
139.article_body: The main races on the second day of the inaugural edition of the Indian Racing League (IRL) in Hyderabad were called off after a minor accident. "There was an incident with one car, and as a matter of abundant precaution...we have postponed the races," an official statement said. On Saturday, nearly 7,500 people turned up to see the event.

140.title: Jazbaa is a case of bad marketing, I've let down Aishwarya: Director
140.article_body: Director Sanjay Gupta spoke about his film 'Jazbaa' (2015) and called it a "case of very bad marketing". He said, with the film, he has let down Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, who was making her acting comeback after five years, and Irrfan Khan. He added that he should've fought the "ridiculous studio heads" who were deciding the marketing campaign for 'Jazbaa'.

141.title: 2-month-old baby thrown in water sump by relatives in Hyd, dies
141.article_body: A two-month-old baby boy was allegedly murdered by his relatives after they threw him in a water sump at their house on Saturday in Uppal, Hyderabad. Uppal police SHO, R Govinda Reddy, said that the infant’s parents live with their in-laws. Police suspect some relatives might have thrown the baby in the sump when his mother was asleep.

142.title: Really sad that B'wood hasn’t shown unity against boycott calls: Saif
142.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan said that it's "really sad" that Bollywood didn't show unity against boycott calls. "Until we've that ability to take that step, we'll never really know the truth of how effective this boycott culture is," he added. Saif further said that he "isn't sure" if people who are making these boycott calls against films are "genuine audience".

143.title: BMC removes 1,500 illegal banners after Diwali, 552 in G-North alone: Report
143.article_body: The BMC has removed 1,500 illegal hoardings across Mumbai during and after Diwali, reports said, adding that out of the total, 552 were removed from the G-North ward alone. "A large number of hoardings, banners and flags were seen in Dadar...during Dussehra rally of Shiv Sena. The hoardings were removed within a few days," a civic official said.

144.title: Tamil Nadu create history, become first-ever team to score 500 runs in a 50-over match
144.article_body: Tamil Nadu have become the first-ever team to breach the 500-run mark in a List A (50-over) match. Tamil Nadu put up a total of 506/2 against Arunachal Pradesh in a Vijay Hazare Trophy match on Monday. The previous highest List A total was recorded by England, who scored 498/4 against Netherlands in June this year.

145.title: Virat Kohli shares pic of water bottle with MS Dhoni's pic, says 'He's everywhere'
145.article_body: Virat Kohli took to his Instagram Stories to share a picture of a water bottle having MS Dhoni's picture on it. Kohli wrote, "He is everywhere...Even on the water bottle." Earlier in September, Kohli had revealed that out of all the players he has played with before, only Dhoni messaged him when he quit Test captaincy.

146.title: Driver who rammed into crowd killing 12 in Bihar rescued from truck
146.article_body: The driver of a truck that rammed into a religious procession in Bihar killing 12 people, including children, was rescued from the mangled vehicle and arrested. He has been admitted to Patna Medical College and efforts are underway to ascertain his identity, police said. Earlier, PM Narendra Modi, President Droupadi Murmu and CM Nitish Kumar expressed grief over the accident.

147.title: UP man chops ex-girlfriend into 6 pieces for marrying someone else; shot in encounter
147.article_body: A man in UP's Azamgarh has been arrested for allegedly killing and chopping his ex-girlfriend into six pieces after she married someone else. Accused Prince Yadav sustained bullet injury on Sunday after he allegedly engaged in an encounter with police who took him to a spot to find Aradhana's head. Police said he had hid a pistol at the spot.

148.title: Ranveer sings & dances to ‘Chammak Challo’ with Akon, shares video
148.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh shared a video in which he was seen singing and dancing to 'Chammak Challo' song from Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Ra.One' with singer Akon. "Throwing it back with the OG," he wrote as he shared the video on his Instagram Stories. The song marked Akon's Bollywood debut. Ranveer & Akon attended the 2022 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix.

149.title: Man takes Uber to rob bank in US, asks driver to wait to take him home
149.article_body: A man allegedly ordered an Uber in Michigan to rob a bank and then asked the driver to wait for him to take him back home. According to the police, the accused used an Uber because his licence was suspended and he was worried about driving without one. He was later arrested and the money was also recovered from him.

150.title: CJI jokes 'Law Minister is genuinely young, I'm an impostor', Rijiju reacts; video viral
150.article_body: On comparison to "youthful looks" of Law Minister Kiren Rijiju, CJI DY Chandrachud joked that the minister was genuinely young while he was an impostor, saying he found out on Google that he was 12 years and 8 days old when the minister was born. Rijiju joked that he doesn't want to give any clarification about his date of birth.

151.title: Williamson ruled out of 3rd T20I vs India due to pre-arranged medical appointment
151.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson has been ruled out of the third and final T20I against India on Tuesday due to a pre-arranged medical appointment. Pacer Tim Southee has been named New Zealand's stand-in captain for the match in Napier. Williamson will return for the three-match ODI series against India, which will begin on November 25.

152.title: B'luru records November's lowest temperature in a decade at 13.9°C
152.article_body: Bengaluru recorded November’s lowest temperature in a decade on Monday with the weather agency recording a minimum temperature of 13.9 degrees Celsius. According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the last time the month of November saw the mercury dip so low in Bengaluru was on November 21, 2012 when the temperature was recorded at 13.3 degrees Celsius.

153.title: Jagadeesan breaks world record for highest score in a 50-over match, slams 277 runs
153.article_body: Tamil Nadu wicketkeeper-opener Narayan Jagadeesan on Monday broke the world record for smashing the highest-ever score in a 50-over match. The 26-year-old slammed 277 runs off 141 deliveries against Arunachal Pradesh in a Vijay Hazare Trophy match to set the record. The previous record was set by Alistair Duncan Brown, who scored 268 runs for Surrey against Glamorgan in 2002.

154.title: Boarded train without ticket to save money, sat near toilet: Rakeysh
154.article_body: Director Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra shared that when he was travelling to Mumbai for the first time, he boarded a train without a ticket "to save money for other expenses". "The ticket collector used to make us sit...near toilets," he recalled. Rakeysh, who debuted with 'Aks' (2001), recalled how he met Gulzar just a few days after he landed in Mumbai.

155.title: Willing to work with those who want to protect freedom: Uddhav Thackeray
155.article_body: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray claimed that the country is heading towards dictatorship and stated that he is willing to work with those who want to protect freedom. "There is a need to throw out people who are greedy…At present, the British policy of 'divide-and-rule' is being followed…Lynching takes place if cow meat is found [but]…rapists…are acquitted," said Uddhav.

156.title: New bridge in place of Carnac bridge will be built within 19 months: BMC
156.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said that a newly reconstructed bridge in place of demolished Carnac Bridge will be completed within 19 months from the day of final demolition. The construction and fabrication works have already begun at a workshop in Ambala and the bridge will be brought to the location when it is ready for final installation, BMC added.

157.title: Gurugram home guard suffers fracture as car runs him over after being stopped
157.article_body: A 30-year-old home guard official, who had signalled a car to stop due to seat belt violation, suffered a fracture after the car ran him over in Gurugram. "The car...hit me and I fell. The car sped away and drove rashly and my leg was crushed underneath one of its front tyres," the victim said. No arrests have been made.

158.title: Iran attacked our bases in Iraq, hit hospital: Exiled Kurdish group
158.article_body: The Democratic Party of Iranian Kurdistan, a Kurdish Iranian group exiled in Iraq, has claimed Iranian missiles and drones struck its bases in Iraq on Sunday. It added that the strikes hit a hospital in Koya. Few Kurdish groups have been engaged in conflict with Iran since the 1979 Iranian revolution and Iran claims these groups are inciting anti-government protests.

159.title: India reports 406 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 6,402
159.article_body: India reported 406 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 492 fresh COVID-19 cases. The number of active cases in India stands at 6,402, as per the ministry. The death toll so far has reached 5,30,586.

160.title: Mangaluru autorickshaw blast accused hospitalised, family pays visit
160.article_body: The accused in the Mangaluru autorickshaw blast Mohammed Shariq has been hospitalised at the Father Muller Medical College. His family also visited him in the hospital on Monday. "If they establish that this is the same person we suspect, then the family members will also be interrogated. One male and three female family members visited him," police said.

161.title: TN's Jagadeesan breaks world record for hitting most consecutive tons in 50-over cricket
161.article_body: Tamil Nadu wicketkeeper-opener Narayan Jagadeesan on Monday broke the world record for smashing most consecutive hundreds in List A cricket. Jagadeesan slammed his fifth consecutive hundred in the ongoing Vijay Hazare tournament to set the record. The previous record was held by Kumar Sangakkara, Devdutt Padikkal and Alviro Petersen, who had slammed four consecutive List A hundreds each.

162.title: Qatar fan fights with Ecuador fan over 'cash' gesture during 2022 FIFA WC opener
162.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a Qatar fan verbally fighting with an Ecuador fan after the latter was seen making a 'cash' gesture in the stands during the 2022 FIFA World Cup opener on Sunday. The Ecuador fan had reportedly made the gesture indicating that the referee was bought by Qatar after a VAR decision went against Ecuador.

163.title: Social media generation in Pakistan calls me a match-fixer: Wasim Akram
163.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has said that while the cricketing world in Australia, England and India remembers him as one of the best bowlers in the world, "the social media generation" in Pakistan calls him a "match-fixer". In the 1990s, Akram was accused of match-fixing. He was later cleared of serious charges, but was slapped with a fine.

164.title: Koshyari must consider quitting as Maha Guv: Pawar on Guv's remark on Shivaji
164.article_body: Reacting to Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari's remark on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, NCP leader Ajit Pawar on Sunday said Koshyari must consider quitting his post. "Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj was a great role model on how to use power for people’s welfare and not self-interest. These ideals have inspired Maharashtra and will continue to do so for time immemorial," Pawar added.

165.title: Italian town to pay people over ₹25 lakh to move there
165.article_body: Officials of the Italian town of Presicce have announced that they are ready to pay people up to €30,000 (over ₹25 lakh) to buy an empty house and reside in the area. The houses have reportedly been abandoned by their original owners. Authorities are set to launch applications soon and release further information, a local councillor said.

166.title: FIR against Congress MLA for rape, unnatural sex, harassment in MP
166.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Police registered an FIR against Congress MLA Umang Singhar for allegedly raping and mentally harassing a woman. The victim has alleged that the MLA raped and assaulted her between November 2021 and November 2022. She also accused the MLA of committing unnatural acts with her. From 2019 to 2020, he was MP's Forest Minister.

167.title: How did 'LoveWhereYouWork' hashtag, being used by laid-off Twitter staff, start?
167.article_body: Several laid-off Twitter employees are tweeting farewell messages using the hashtag #LoveWhereYouWork. The hashtag was first used by Lucy Mosley, a UK-based Twitter employee, in 2013. After Mosley was diagnosed with cancer, her co-workers decided to knit a blanket and send it to her in hospital. Mosley later tweeted a picture of herself with the blanket, alongside #LoveWhereYouWork in caption.

168.title: Moment of truth for startups likely to come in 2023: Flipkart CEO
168.article_body: Flipkart CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy has said some amount of "moment of truth" for startups will likely come into the market by April or May next year. "People will have to go back and raise money. At that time, we will have to see what happens to valuations," he said. "What happens to global markets will eventually translate everywhere," he added.

169.title: 19th-century Bhoot Bangla, water treatment plant in Mumbai to be restored
169.article_body: The Mumbai Heritage Conservation Committee (MHCC) has given its nod to restore a deserted inspection bungalow constructed in 1860 also officially known as Bhoot Bangla and the water treatment plant at Tulsi lake constructed in 1879. Restoration of the bungalow may cost over ₹1 crore and restoration of the filtration plant will cost around ₹15 crore, according to BMC.

170.title: I’ve no mercy for those using kids' deaths for gain: Musk on reinstating Alex Jones' Twitter
170.article_body: A Twitter user asked Elon Musk if radio host Alex Jones' Twitter account will be reinstated. Musk replied, "My firstborn child died in my arms. I felt his last heartbeat. I've no mercy for anyone who would use the deaths of children for gain, politics or fame.” Jones' account was banned after he called a US school shooting a "hoax".

171.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra 'revolutionary moment' for national politics, not event: Jairam
171.article_body: The Bharat Jodo Yatra is a “revolutionary moment" for national politics as well as for the party and not an event, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said while adding that converting it into electoral success will take a while. "The Congress is the only ideology that presents an alternative to the BJP and the RSS," Ramesh added.

172.title: Congress will disappear in BJP's tsunami: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai
172.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai criticised the Congress for doing nothing for the welfare of the SC and ST communities and claimed that the Congress would disappear in the BJP's tsunami. "PM Modi rendered justice to every community...Congress has only talked about the welfare of SC/ST communities but never alleviated their poverty," said Bommai.

173.title: I'm shocked: Man whose Aadhaar card was stolen by Mangaluru blast accused
173.article_body: Railway employee Premraj Hutagi, whose Aadhaar card was stolen by the Mangaluru autorickshaw blast accused, said that he is shocked. "I never imagined that my name and the card will be misused to this extent," he added. Hutagi also said that he had not reported the loss of his Aadhaar card to the police.

174.title: 2 dead as goods train derails in Odisha's Korai, rescue operation underway
174.article_body: Two people died after a goods train derailed at Korai railway station in Odisha on Monday around 6:44 am, Railways said. Relief teams have rushed to the site and a rescue operation is underway. A station building was damaged. CM Naveen Patnaik tweeted, "Condolences to the families of those who lost their lives and wishes for the speedy recovery of...injured."

175.title: Fans chant 'we want beer' during FIFA World Cup match in Qatar; video viral
175.article_body: The Ecuador supporters on Sunday chanted "Queremos cerveza (we want beer)" during their country's opening game of the FIFA World Cup against the host country Qatar. This comes after Qatar decided to ban beer sales at the stadiums during the World Cup. Ecuador registered 2-0 win over Qatar in the match.
