176.title: Twitter will not die instantly, but it may decay over time: Ex-Twitter India head
176.article_body: Twitter India's former head Manish Maheshwari said that the social media platform, which was recently acquired by Elon Musk, will "not die instantly". However, if it continues at the current rate, it may decay over time, he added. Maheshwari also noted that Musk's recent actions have been "pretty brash and impulsive" and that he must figure things out at Twitter.

177.title: Residents protest as fire extinguishers fail to work at Noida high-rise
177.article_body: Residents of Logix Blossom County society in Noida Sector 137 held a protest on Sunday after a fire incident was reported in a flat and none of the eight fire extinguishers on the floor were in working condition. Residents also filed a complaint with the fire department and a safety audit will be conducted in the next two days.

178.title: I’ve done some weird crap in life like drinking water from faecal sludge: Bill Gates
178.article_body: The world’s fifth richest man Bill Gates said he has done some "weird crap" in his life in a LinkedIn post to mark World Toilet Day. Gates wrote, "I’ve done some weird crap over the years: I drank water from faecal sludge with Jimmy Fallon, shared the stage with a jar of human faeces, and smelled pit latrine odour."

179.title: Had never heard of crypto firm FTX or its ex-CEO before: Zoho CEO
179.article_body: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu has said he had never heard of the crypto exchange FTX or its former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried until FTX's recent collapse. "I knew of BTC and ETH and had read the original Bitcoin paper and that was about the extent of my interest," he said. Vembu added he "concluded early on I will stick with gold".

180.title: Chris Hemsworth to take time off acting, says he's likely to get Alzheimer's
180.article_body: Hollywood star Chris Hemsworth shared that he'll "take time off" from acting and spend time with his family after he found out that he's likely to develop Alzheimer's disease. Chris underwent some genetic tests during his series 'Limitless' and shared that he has two copies of APOE4, the gene that has the strongest correlation to the development of Alzheimer's disease.

181.title: Musk has bigger purpose behind buying Twitter, it's political clout: Ex-Twitter India head
181.article_body: Former Twitter India head Manish Maheshwari has said that Elon Musk has a bigger purpose behind acquiring Twitter which is not purely commercial. He added, "Because if it were commercial, he'd probably have acted in the interest of advertisers...He wants to further his non-commercial agenda, which is to have more significant political clout and have Twitter to support his ideology."

182.title: Retired IAS Arun Goel appointed as the Election Commissioner of India
182.article_body: Retired IAS officer Arun Goel has been appointed as the new Election Commissioner of India. Goel was Secretary of the Ministry of Heavy Industries before he was appointed as the Election Commissioner. He has also worked as the Secretary of Heavy Industries in 2019 and also of the Culture Ministry. He has also served as Vice-Chairman of Delhi Development Authority.

183.title: Bus catches fire after colliding with bike near Punjab's Bathinda, 2 killed
183.article_body: Two people were killed after a bus burst into flames near Gurthari village in Bathinda on Sunday night after it collided with a motorcycle, news agency ANI reported. Police said that no passenger was on the bus at the time of the incident. ANI also shared a picture of the burning bus and damaged motorcycle.

184.title: We need Uniform Civil Code, law against 'love jihad': Assam CM
184.article_body: Citing the recent Shraddha Walkar murder case, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma asserted that the country needs a Uniform Civil Code (UCC) and a strict law against 'love jihad'. "Our country doesn't need Aftab but a person like Lord Ram, a leader like PM Modi. We need such laws where Aftabs can be hanged to death," said Sarma.

185.title: Pune police arrests 2 men for peddling drugs through social media
185.article_body: The Anti Narcotics Cell of Pune City Police’s Crime Branch arrested two men for allegedly peddling mephedrone and charas after approaching potential customers through social media messaging applications. Police recovered over 47 grams of charas, worth over ₹47,000 in the illegal market, from one of the suspects. While 5.7 grams of mephedrone worth around ₹86,000 was recovered from other suspect.

186.title: Salt Bae shares clip of gold-coated steak after criticism over customer's ₹1.3-crore bill
186.article_body: Celebrity chef Nusret Gökçe, also known as Salt Bae, shared a clip of 24 karat gold-coated steak served at his restaurants. This comes amid criticism over a customer's ₹1.3-crore bill at his UAE restaurant. A person criticising him commented, "Seeing this bill and thinking of my patients who cannot afford the cost of their liver transplant makes me sad."

187.title: Delhi to challenge SC's order to release Chhawla gang rape convicts: Reports
187.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has approved filing a review petition by Aam Aadmi Party government in Supreme Court against its order to release three convicts in the 2012 Chhawla gang rape and murder case, claimed reports. The convicts were earlier given death sentences. Saxena has also approved the appointment of SG Tushar Mehta to represent the Delhi government's case.

188.title: When will we decide we’ve had enough: Biden on shooting at gay nightclub
188.article_body: President Joe Biden said US cannot and must not tolerate hate, hours after five people were killed in a shooting at a gay nightclub in Colorado Springs. "When will we decide we've had enough? We must address public health epidemic of gun violence in all of its forms," he said. He added safe spaces shouldn't turn into places of terror.

189.title: Amitabh called me for a role in 'Ek Rishtaa...', I felt I had arrived: Suneel
189.article_body: Filmmaker Suneel Darshan said that actor Amitabh Bachchan called him for a role in his movie 'Ek Rishtaa: The Bond Of Love'. "I was overjoyed. I was so honoured...That was the only time in my life I felt I had arrived; when you get a call from a star...who is on the stature of Amitabh Bachchan," he added.

190.title: 'Hera Pheri' is my favourite film, says Kartik Aaryan
190.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has called 'Hera Pheri' his "favourite film" amid reports of him joining the third instalment of the popular franchise. Kartik will reportedly play a new character in 'Hera Pheri 3', which will also star Paresh Rawal and Suniel Shetty. Earlier, Akshay Kumar announced his exit from the film due to creative differences.

191.title: I want more batters to chip in with the ball: Hardik Pandya
191.article_body: Team India's stand-in captain Hardik Pandya has said he wants to see more bowling options going forward after their 65-run win against New Zealand in the second T20I. Hardik himself didn't bowl in the match but used six bowlers. "Not always that this will work but I want more batters to chip in with the ball," he added.

192.title: Tank 'purified' with cow urine after Dalit woman drinks water in K'taka
192.article_body: A few upper-caste villagers in Chamarajanagar district, Karnataka, drained drinking water from a mini-tank and 'purified' it with cow urine after a Dalit woman drank water from the tank. "The woman came from HD Kote to attend the wedding...the villagers abused the woman and decided to purify the tank [after she drank water from the tank]," a villager said.

193.title: Delhi's air quality 'very poor' with AQI at 319, temp likely to drop to 9°C
193.article_body: The air quality in Delhi was in 'very poor' category on Monday as Air Quality Index (AQI) was 319 at 7 am, according to Central Pollution Control Board's data. Meanwhile, the minimum temperature is expected to drop to 9°C. AQI is likely to be within 'poor' or 'lower end of very poor' for the next three days, according to SAFAR.

194.title: US President Biden's wife Jill shares pics of their dance on his 80th birthday
194.article_body: US' First Lady Jill Biden shared pictures of her dance with US President Joe Biden to wish him on his 80th birthday. "There's no one else I'd rather dance with than you. Happy Birthday, Joe! I love you," she tweeted with the pictures. She also shared a picture of Biden cutting his birthday cake with family.

195.title: Bob Iger named Disney CEO less than a year after retiring from company
195.article_body: The Walt Disney Company on Monday announced that Bob Iger will be returning as CEO effective immediately. The announcement comes days after former CEO Bob Chapek said Disney planned to freeze hiring and cut some jobs. Iger, who retired from Disney 11 months ago and held the CEO role for 15 years, will serve as CEO for two more years.

196.title: They say posts are politically incorrect, it's dishonest: Saif on social media
196.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan said that he likes to record things and could share them if he was to join social media. However, he feels that social media becomes too dishonest since he would have to talk to some manager before he posts anything. "People say don't share this, don't share that...They say this is too politically incorrect," he added.

197.title: PM Modi-led govt weakening laws empowering tribals: Rahul Gandhi
197.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday stated that PM Narendra Modi-led central government is weakening laws framed by the UPA to empower tribals. He said his party will revive them after returning to power. The PM Modi-led government has been weakening laws like Forest Rights, Land Rights, Panchayat Raj Acts and the reservation for women in local bodies, Gandhi said.

198.title: 'Testing Testing,' says Kanye West on return to Twitter after ban; Musk reacts
198.article_body: Rapper Ye, formerly known as Kanye West, returned to Twitter on Sunday and tweeted, "Testing Testing Seeing if my Twitter is unblocked." Replying to his tweet, Elon Musk wrote, "Don't kill what ye hate. Save what ye love.” West's account was suspended last month over antisemitism. Recently, former US President Donald Trump's Twitter account was reinstated after nearly two years.

199.title: Chiranjeevi named Indian Film Personality of the Year at IFFI 2022
199.article_body: Telugu actor Chiranjeevi was honoured with the Indian Film Personality of the Year award during the opening ceremony of the 53rd edition of the International Film Festival of India (IFFI). The announcement was made by Union Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur. Reacting to the news, Chiranjeevi said he's "delighted and humbled" and expressed his gratitude towards the government.

200.title: Actress Ghaziani removes hijab in public in Instagram post, arrested in Iran
200.article_body: Actress Hengameh Ghaziani has been arrested in Iran a day after she shared a clip on Instagram of herself removing her hijab in public, Iranian state media reported. "Maybe this will be my last post. From this moment on, whatever happens to me, know that as always, I'm with Iranian people until my last breath," she wrote in her post.

201.title: Central Railway dismantles Mumbai's Carnac Bridge before time
201.article_body: The Central Railway demolished the British-era Carnac bridge, situated between Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus and Masjid Bunder, in less than the stipulated time on Sunday. The mega block, which was scheduled to be removed at 8 pm for central and harbour line, saw the first train roll out on central line at 4 pm and harbour line at 6 pm.

202.title: Facebook is dying, won't be surprised if it's shut down: Ex-Twitter India head
202.article_body: Twitter India's former head Manish Maheshwari told Financial Express, "Facebook is dying and I won't be surprised if at some stage it's even closed down." Speaking about Meta's recent decision to fire over 11,000 employees, he said, "Meta doesn't need a large number of employees, and rightsizing was imminent at some point." He added that "tech winter has set in".

203.title: When we look for partners who can move a global agenda, PM Modi is very high on list: US
203.article_body: Principal Deputy NSA Jon Finer has said when the US and President Joe Biden look for partners that can help move forward a global agenda, India and PM Narendra Modi are very high on that list. He added, "In the G-20 Summit, PM Modi was instrumental in forging a consensus around a joint statement among a far-flung group of countries."

204.title: Mangaluru auto IED blast suspect wanted for alleged links with IS: Police
204.article_body: The suspect in IED explosion in an autorickshaw in Mangaluru is wanted for his alleged links with Islamic State (IS), police said. The suspect, who has been identified as 24-year-old Mohammed Shariq, has been charged with links to the IS and has been on the run since September 2022. Shariq had previously been booked under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act.

205.title: Death toll rises to 12 in Bihar truck accident, CM grants ₹5 lakh ex-gratia
205.article_body: At least 12 people, a third of them children, died after a speeding truck rammed into a religious procession in the Vaishali district of Bihar on Sunday, officials said. People had gathered in front of a peepal tree to offer prayers to a deity. Bihar CM Nitish Kumar announced a compensation of ₹5 lakh for the kin of the deceased.

206.title: Mumbai woman looking to transfer money to another account loses ₹11.69 lakh
206.article_body: A 58-year-old woman from Mumbai's Lokhandwala was cheated of ₹11.69 lakh by a fraudster after she contacted a number she thought was of bank's customer care. She made the call after she was unable to send money from her account to another account, reports said. The fraudster made her download remote access application and made her log into bank accounts.

207.title: Chaos breaks out at FIFA World Cup fan zone in Qatar, pics surface
207.article_body: Chaos broke out at a FIFA World Cup fan zone in Qatar's Doha, an hour before the start of the opening match between Qatar and Ecuador. This happened after double the number of people tried to make their way inside the venue which has a capacity of 40,000. Police took around 45 minutes to clear excess fans from the area.

208.title: Djokovic wins record-breaking ₹39-crore prize money for clinching 2022 ATP Finals
208.article_body: Twenty one-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic on Sunday defeated Casper Ruud in the final to win the ATP Finals title for a record-equalling sixth time. Djokovic won the match with a scoreline of 7-5, 6-3 in Italy's Turin. The 35-year-old ex-world number one received an all-time record prize money of $4,740,300 (nearly ₹39 crore) for being the undefeated champion.

209.title: US judge orders Amazon to stop retaliating against staff for activism
209.article_body: A New York federal judge has ordered Amazon to cease and desist from retaliating against employees for workplace activism. Under the ruling, Amazon will have to read out the order to its workers at a Staten Island warehouse. District Judge Diane Gujarati denied a request for an injunction to reinstate a fired activist, Gerald Bryson, made by the NLRB.

210.title: Qatar become first host nation to lose opening match in FIFA World Cup history
210.article_body: Qatar on Sunday became the first-ever host nation to lose opening match in the 92-year history of FIFA World Cup. The hosts lost 0-2 against Ecuador in Al Khor. Further, Qatar are the first host nation to fail to record a shot on target in a World Cup match since the US against Brazil in round of 16 in 1994.

211.title: BSF seizes 1,025 bottles of Phensedyl cough syrup in Meghalaya
211.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) seized 1,025 bottles of Phensedyl cough syrup along the International Border in Meghalaya's West Jaintia Hills district on Saturday, ANI reported. The bottles of Phensedyl were reportedly meant to be smuggled to Bangladesh. BSF informed that it has recovered 7,433 bottles of Phensedyl cough syrup along the India-Bangladesh border this year itself.

212.title: 8 killed as truck rams into crowd in Bihar, PM announces ₹2 lakh ex-gratia
212.article_body: At least eight people died and several others were injured after a speeding truck rammed into a crowd in Bihar's Vaishali on Sunday, police said. People were reportedly assembled at the Mahnar-Hajipur highway to witness a puja procession of Bhuiyan Baba. PM Narendra Modi, while expressing grief, announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the families of the deceased.

213.title: Ecuador beat hosts Qatar in 2022 FIFA WC opener as Valencia creates history
213.article_body: Ecuador defeated hosts Qatar 2-0 in 2022 FIFA World Cup opener at Al Bayt Stadium in Al Khor on Sunday. Ecuador captain Enner Valencia scored both the goals. With this, the 33-year-old created history by becoming Ecuador's leading goal-scorer in FIFA World Cup history with a total of five goals. He overtook Agustín Delgado, who had scored 3 goals.

214.title: Hurt by insulting remarks on Pandit Nehru & Indira Gandhi: Abdullah
214.article_body: National Conference President Farooq Abdullah said he was hurt by "derogatory remarks" against former PMs Jawaharlal Nehru and Indira Gandhi. "Nehru jailed my father, while (Indira) Gandhi dismissed my government...But I have a lot of respect for them because of their contribution to India," said Abdullah. He added that those pointing fingers at them will face the same fate.

215.title: 2 Islamists, on death row for killing secular blogger, flee Dhaka court
215.article_body: Two Islamist extremists, who were sentenced to death for killing Bangladeshi-American secular blogger Avijit Roy and his publisher, escaped from the premises of a court in Bangladesh's capital Dhaka on Sunday. The duo escaped with the help of two unidentified bikers who sprayed a chemical on police personnel and created a smoke screen before whisking away the convicts, police said.

216.title: Synchronised rate hikes can spark recession: RBI Governor
216.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das said that synchronised tightening of monetary policy globally can increase the risk of recession to tame inflation. However, he added that India is placed differently. The RBI has increased the repo rate by 50 basis points (bps) in each of the previous three policy reviews by the central bank's Monetary Policy Committee.

217.title: Time for it is also coming: Suryakumar Yadav on Test call-up
217.article_body: During a press conference after India's 65-run victory over New Zealand in second T20I, a journalist asked Suryakumar Yadav about his aspiration to play Test cricket. "Aa raha hai. Wo time bhi aa raha hai (It's coming. Time for it is coming)," Suryakumar said. "I have a good idea about the format...I enjoy the format a lot," he added.

218.title: Crime reduced by 30% since BJP came to power in Tripura: CM Saha
218.article_body: Tripura CM Dr Manik Saha said there has been a 30% decline in crimes against women in the state since 2018. He added that eve-teasing has been reduced by nearly 60%, molestation by 35%, rape and dowry deaths by 10% each, and murder by 15%. CM Saha added that Tripura is second among northeastern states in the seizure of drugs.

219.title: 'Power Rangers' actor Jason David Frank passes away at 49
219.article_body: Jason David Frank, best known as Tommy Oliver or the Green Ranger of 'Power Rangers', passed away at the age of 49 in Texas. TMZ, citing sources, reported that he died by suicide. The actor's representative said, "Please respect the privacy of his family and friends during this horrible time as we come to terms with his loss."

220.title: Suryakumar is a player that can hit and hurt you in many areas: Southee
220.article_body: New Zealand pacer Tim Southee said India batter Suryakumar Yadav's "exceptional" innings was miles apart from anything else his side saw in second T20I. "He's a player that can hit...and hurt you in a number of areas. He's had a great 12-18 months in IPL, international cricket. Came up against a pretty impressive knock today," he added. Suryakumar hit 111*(51).

221.title: More to life than racing in circles, feeling a bit empty: Sebastian Vettel
221.article_body: Four-time world champion Sebastian Vettel said there was more to life than "racing in circles" as he retired from F1 at the season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. "I enjoyed the race...once the lights go off its full-on race mode," said Vettel. He added that he felt "a bit empty" after the race and will "miss more than" he 'understands'.

222.title: BJP-JJP govt in Haryana has pushed state into debt trap: Hooda
222.article_body: Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda said the BJP-JJP government in Haryana has pushed the state into a debt trap with its "wrong economic policies". "The government's...policies have pushed the total debt...to ₹3,11,779 crore," he said. He added that in the last eight years, no medical college, national-level institute, railway line or big project has come up in Haryana.

223.title: President Droupadi Murmu undergoes cataract surgery in right eye
223.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu underwent cataract surgery in her right eye at the Army Hospital (Referral and Research) in Delhi on Sunday, the Rashtrapati Bhavan said. The surgery was successful and she has been discharged from the hospital. President Murmu, 64, had undergone cataract surgery in her left eye at the same Army Hospital on October 16 this year.

224.title: India's CEC Rajiv Kumar observes general elections in Nepal
224.article_body: India's Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Rajiv Kumar led a four-member delegation to observe Nepal's general elections. Nepal is voting to elect a new parliament and provincial assemblies. On Sunday, polls were held to elect 275 members of the House of Representatives and 550 seats of the seven Provincial Assemblies. To supervise the polls, 46 organisations were assigned.

225.title: Why waste votes on Congress: PM Modi at Gujarat poll rally
225.article_body: While addressing a poll rally in Gujarat's Amreli, Prime Minister Narendra Modi appealed to the people to not waste their votes on Congress considering that it did not have a roadmap for development. "The Opposition party can never do anything good for you," PM Modi said and added that a "Congress leader cannot take the path of development".

226.title: Mahatma Gandhi wanted Congress to stop being a party: Ram Madhav
226.article_body: BJP leader Ram Madhav said Mahatma Gandhi wanted Congress to work towards attaining social, economic, and moral freedom instead of as a political party after attaining Independence from the British. He added that Congress leaders had stopped listening to Mahatma Gandhi. "Gandhi Ji's wish...seems to be fulfilled by another Gandhi," said Madhav in a veiled criticism of Rahul Gandhi.

227.title: Canada sanctions Haiti's former Prez, 2 ex-PMs for financing gangs
227.article_body: Canada has sanctioned Haiti's former President Michel Martelly and two former Haitian PMs for their roles in financing gangs, Canada's ambassador to Haiti said on Sunday. In September, Haitian gangs created a humanitarian crisis by blocking a fuel terminal for nearly six weeks. Canada, along with the US and the UN, has sanctioned political leaders who allegedly financed the gangs.

228.title: We don't want him to leave: Mac Allister on Messi retiring from int'l football
228.article_body: Argentina midfielder Ale Mac Allister said his side doesn't want Lionel Messi to leave the national team as the seven-time Ballon d'Or winner revealed last month that the World Cup in Qatar 2022 would be his last. "He's very important for us, for the country. So hopefully, he is not [retiring]," he added. Argentina will face Saudi Arabia on Tuesday.

229.title: Indonesian edtech startup Ruangguru lays off hundreds of employees
229.article_body: Tiger Global-backed Indonesian edtech startup Ruangguru said it laid off hundreds of employees amid a deteriorating global economy. While the company didn't specify the number of employees who will lose jobs, it said it will provide severance pay and other compensation. "We apologise for our failure to predict and anticipate the rapidly developing economic situation," Ruangguru founders said.

230.title: BSF fire at, push back 2 Pakistani drones near International Border
230.article_body: A drone from Pakistan was spotted close to the international border in the Kassowal area of Punjab's Gurdaspur district. The unmanned aerial vehicle flew back to Pakistan after BSF personnel fired at least 96 rounds at the drone and also used five illumination bombs. BSF fired at and pushed back another drone in Amritsar district's Channa Patan area on Saturday.

231.title: Marriage with Muslim minor not excluded from POCSO: Kerala HC
231.article_body: Kerala High Court ruled that marriage with a Muslim minor isn't excluded from the POCSO Act. "If one of the parties to the marriage is a minor...offences under the POCSO Act will apply," Justice Bechu Kurian Thomas ruled. He was hearing the bail plea of a man accused of raping and then marrying a 16-year-old girl.

232.title: Ex-lover arrested for chopping woman's body in 6 pieces in UP
232.article_body: A former lover of a woman has been arrested for killing the woman and chopping her body in six pieces, officials said. The man was hit by a bullet in a gunfire encounter when he was taken to the spot of crime for recovering the woman's head. The woman's chopped body was found in a well on November 15.

233.title: Formula 1 journalist doesn't recognise Ranveer Singh in Abu Dhabi, video goes viral
233.article_body: A video went viral showing F1 journalist and ex-racing driver Martin John Brundle failing to recognise actor Ranveer Singh in Abu Dhabi. While interviewing Ranveer during his grid walk at Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, Brundle asked Ranveer to introduce himself as he couldn't recognise him. Ranveer responded, "I'm a Bollywood actor and I hail from Mumbai, India. I'm an entertainer."

234.title: MP govt to move SC against relief to interfaith couples
234.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government decided to move the Supreme Court to challenge the high court's interim order restraining it from prosecuting interfaith couples getting married without informing the district magistrate. A division bench called Section 10 of the anti-conversion act "unconstitutional". Petitioners sought interim relief against prosecution under the MP Freedom of Religion Act (MPFRA).

235.title: US' Alabama fails to execute convict; 3rd such instance since 2018
235.article_body: The US state of Alabama called off the execution of a death row inmate after prison officials failed to find a suitable vein to inject the lethal drugs late Thursday. Kenneth Eugene Smith's death warrant expired later at midnight. Smith's uncompleted execution was Alabama's second failed execution attempt in the past two months and the third since 2018.

236.title: 48 vehicles damaged in accident on Pune-Bengaluru highway, many feared injured
236.article_body: A major accident occurred at Navale bridge on the Pune-Bengaluru highway in which around 48 vehicles got damaged, officials said. Rescue teams from the Pune Fire Brigade and Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) have reached the spot, officials added. Multiple persons are feared to be injured in the accident.

237.title: I haven't done anything: Man whose identity Mangaluru blast suspect stole
237.article_body: Indian Railways employee Premraj Hutagi, whose identity Mangaluru blast suspect Mohammed Shariq stole, said he hasn't done anything and he's "innocent". "I never imagined that my name and [Aadhaar] card will be misused to this extent...I got to know about the explosion from police...I've been in constant fear since then," Hutagi added. He had lost his Aadhaar card twice earlier.

238.title: Rishabh Pant should look to time the ball, not hit it hard: Nehra
238.article_body: Former India cricketer Ashish Nehra said Rishabh Pant should look to time the ball, rather than hitting it hard. "Pant did not look in good touch...want to see how much does this opening pair (of Pant and Ishan Kishan) gets backed by the team management," said Nehra. Pant scored six of 13 balls during the second T20I against New Zealand.

239.title: What he's doing is really special: Karthik on Suryakumar's ton vs NZ
239.article_body: Praising India batter Suryakumar Yadav following his 111* runs in 51 balls against New Zealand in Mount Maunganui, Dinesh Karthik said, "What he's doing is really special." He added that using the pace consistently and the ability to hit on both sides of the wicket comes naturally to the 32-year-old. Suryakumar hit 11 fours and seven sixes during his knock.

240.title: I hate Trump but that doesn't change freedom of speech rules: Elon's brother
240.article_body: Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk reacted to former US President Donald Trump's return to Twitter by tweeting, "I hate Trump to the bottom of my soul (is that hate speech? I’m sorry)." Kimbal added, "That doesn't change freedom of speech rules that have been carefully and successfully formed since America's founding." Kimbal's remarks come after Trump's Twitter account was reinstated.

241.title: 3 killed, 1 hurt after car rams into truck on Bareilly-Nainital road
241.article_body: Three persons, including a woman, died on the spot and another person was seriously injured when a car rammed into a truck on the Bareilly-Nainital road on Sunday, police said. The injured person was rushed to a private hospital, where he is undergoing treatment, Bareilly Superintendent of Police (SP) said.

242.title: Logan Sargeant earns F1 Super License to race for Williams in 2023
242.article_body: American racing driver Logan Sargeant has earned the Super License he needs to race for Williams F1 in the 2023 season. Sargeant, who needed to finish at least sixth, came fourth in Formula Two to qualify for the F1 Super License. Sargeant, who will partner with Alex Albon, takes over the race seat occupied this year by Canadian Nicholas Latifi.

243.title: Why do Denmark's FIFA jerseys have black & other 'toned down' colours?
243.article_body: Denmark have decided to wear 'toned down' FIFA World Cup 2022 jerseys to protest Qatar's human rights record. Danish FIFA kit provider Hummel designed a kit completely in black or the "colour of mourning", apart from red and white. Hummel said it "does not wish to be visible" in the tournament over the alleged cost to human lives.

244.title: Tabu is the golden girl of the industry right now: Kiara Advani
244.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani, when asked about being the golden girl of Bollywood, said, "Right now, (the golden girl of the industry) is Tabu ma'am after the success of Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 and Drishyam 2." "She has taken over," Kiara added. 'Drishyam 2' has collected ₹36.97 crore in India within two days of its release.

245.title: Tabassum ji used to tease me about my girlfriends back in the day: Shatrughan
245.article_body: Shatrughan Sinha, remembering late actress Tabassum, said she was a "lively, sharp and good human being". "She would always tease me because I used to stay just next door...She used to send messages and tease me about my girlfriends visiting my house, back in the day," he added. Tabassum passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest on Friday.

246.title: Vietnam man who questioned pandemic response gets 8 years in jail
246.article_body: A 41-year-old man was handed an eight-year prison sentence for "anti-state activities" by a court in Vietnam's Thanh Hoa province on Friday after a two-day trial. Bui Van Thuan was detained after he posted a comment on Facebook questioning the administration's handling of the pandemic. He'll be placed under house arrest for five years following his release, Thuan's lawyers said.

247.title: 'Govinda...' is different film, we're very proud of it: Karan Johar
247.article_body: Producer Karan Johar, speaking about Vicky Kaushal-starrer 'Govinda Naam Mera', has said that the film is "very different" and added that they are "very proud" of it. "I'm always looking for a good story and when that comes on my table, I get excited," he further added. 'Govinda Naam Mera' also features Bhumi Pednekar and Kiara Advani.

248.title: Decriminalise GST law, reduce personal income tax rates: CII to govt
248.article_body: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has asked the government to decriminalise the GST in the forthcoming Budget. CII argued that the GST law already contains adequate penal provisions for deterrence against taxes' evasion. CII President Sanjiv Bajaj further demanded a reduction in personal income tax rates, saying, "This would increase disposable incomes and revive the demand cycle."

249.title: Ecuador's Enner Valencia scores first goal of 2022 FIFA World Cup through penalty
249.article_body: Ecuador's 33-year-old striker Enner Valencia scored the first goal of 2022 FIFA World Cup by converting a penalty in 16th minute against hosts Qatar in the opener at the Al Bayt Stadium in Al Khor. Earlier, in the third minute of the match, Valencia had scored a goal through a header, but it didn't count as it was ruled offside.

250.title: Aus best team to play with before World Cup: Ind hockey skipper
250.article_body: Indian skipper Harmanpreet Singh said that Australia is the best team to play with before the FIH Men's Hockey World Cup 2023 in January in Odisha. "Good opportunity to try new things. What works for us and what does not...Even a practice match can help us get better. All matches before the World Cup are important," Harmanpreet said.

251.title: Was hungry to do film where I didn't have to cry: Vicky on 'Govinda...'
251.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal, speaking about his film 'Govinda Naam Mera', has said that he was "hungry" to do a film where he did not have to cry. "In this film, the suffering has finally ended. I was very happy," he further added. Bhumi Pednekar and Kiara Advani also feature in the film, which is directed by Shashank Khaitan.

252.title: Car overturns after driver suffers heart attack in Himachal; 11 injured
252.article_body: A car overturned after its driver suffered a heart attack and lost control of the vehicle in Himachal Pradesh's Una district on Sunday, injuring 11 passengers. The villagers took the injured persons to a hospital and two women with severe injuries were taken to a hospital in Chandigarh. All the passengers were returning to their homes in the car.

253.title: Extremely disappointing: Saif on performance of 'Vikram Vedha' at box office
253.article_body: Saif Ali Khan said that it was "extremely disappointing" for him to witness the poor box office performance of his film 'Vikram Vedha'. On being asked about the majority of Bollywood films not performing at the box office, he said, "I've no idea but something is happening." 'Vikram Vedha' was a remake of 2017 Tamil film of the same name.

254.title: 'Adipurush' is part of our history, is extremely important: Kriti Sanon
254.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon, speaking about her film 'Adipurush', has said, "It's a film which is of the grand canvas, it's a part of our history...is extremely important." "It needs to be put out in the right way...in the best possible way because that's what Om Raut...had envisioned," she added. The film's teaser was trolled over its VFX on Twitter.

255.title: Was offered the role of a psycho: Kalki on being stereotyped
255.article_body: Actress Kalki Koechlin has said that she has been stereotyped in her roles, and it has been frustrating. "I can kind of relate to being...sidekick, the best friend who's funny but annoying or just somebody who's not...likeable or...home-breaker," she said. "A director once approached me for a role saying 'you're going to love this...because it's about a psycho'," Kalki added.

256.title: My main focus is to win TT medal at Olympics: Manika Batra
256.article_body: Indian table tennis player Manika Batra, who recently became the first-ever Indian woman to win a medal at Asian Cup, said her main focus is to win a medal at Olympics and beat top players over there. India have never won a table tennis medal at Olympics. Manika won a bronze medal at recently concluded Asian Cup in Bangkok.

257.title: Previous UP govts 'criminalised politics', 'politicised crime': CM Yogi
257.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that previous state governments "criminalised politics" and "politicised crime". "Security is the top priority for us," CM Yogi said at an event in UP's Saharanpur district. He added, "The state, where hooliganism was at its peak and people were migrating and communal clashes took place every three to four days, has become riot-free today."

258.title: Partnerships required for chasing such target: Southee after loss to India
258.article_body: New Zealand seamer Tim Southee commented on the 65-run-loss against India. "Just not able to get going. When you are chasing such a target you need partnerships at some stage," Southee said. India had set a target of 192 runs in the second T20I at Mount Maunganui on Sunday. Notably, Southee clinched a hat-trick in the match.

259.title: Suryakumar's innings was miles apart from other batters: Southee
259.article_body: New Zealand bowler Tim Southee commented on Indian batter Suryakumar Yadav's match-winning century in the second T20I on Sunday. "His (Suryakumar) innings was miles apart from what we saw today from others. His innings took the score to more than what we were hoping for today. Exceptional innings," Southee said. Notably, Yadav scored an unbeaten 111 off 51 balls.

260.title: Hopefully Test cap will come soon: Suryakumar after his 2nd T20I ton
260.article_body: After his unbeaten 111(51) helped India beat New Zealand by 65 runs in second T20I, India batter Suryakumar Yadav, who hasn't made his Test debut so far, said he's hoping that the Test cap will come soon. It was Suryakumar's second T20I ton. Suryakumar added that he has a fair idea about Test cricket, having played 77 first-class matches.

261.title: Heartiest congratulations: Anurag Thakur to Manika on her Asian Cup bronze
261.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur congratulated Manika Batra after the paddler became the first-ever Indian woman to win a medal at Asian Cup. "Heartiest congratulations Manika for creating history," he wrote on Twitter. World number 44 Manika defeated world number six Hina Hayata of Japan 4-2 to win a bronze medal at Asian Cup in Bangkok on Saturday.

262.title: Canadian spy agency investigating death threats from Iran
262.article_body: The Canadian Security Intelligence Service (CSIS) is probing several death threats from Iran to people living in Canada on the basis of "credible intelligence", the agency said in a statement. The threats are "designed to silence those who speak out publicly" against Iran, it added. CSIS said it was working closely with Iranian-Canadian communities which had been targeted  "disproportionately".

263.title: Company to blame for broken ribs, sliced ear, crushed hand: Rivian's US employees
263.article_body: American electric vehicle maker Rivian has been accused of safety violations at its Illinois plant by a dozen employees. They allege that the company ignored known hazards and deprioritised safety resources, resulting in a crushed hand, a broken foot, a sliced ear and broken ribs. The employees also allege they were forced to share respirators required during the manufacturing process.

264.title: 55-yr-old man killed, body chopped into pieces allegedly by son in West Bengal
264.article_body: A 55-year-old man was killed and his body was allegedly cut into pieces and dumped in various places by his son in West Bengal. The wife and college-going son of the man, who retired from the Navy 12 years ago, were arrested in connection with the crime on Saturday. The mother-son duo claimed to be "continuously tortured" by the man.

265.title: I'll be stupid to even think of a special shot in Suryakumar's 111*: Shastri
265.article_body: On being asked to choose a special shot in Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 111 off 51 balls against New Zealand in second T20I, Ravi Shastri said, "I'll be stupid to even try and think of a special shot because they were all special." "Last 64 runs came in just 18 deliveries, which is mind-boggling," he stated. India won by 65 runs.

266.title: In pics: 2022 FIFA World Cup opening ceremony in Qatar
266.article_body: The 2022 FIFA World Cup kicked off in Qatar on Sunday. The opening ceremony of the tournament featured a performance by American actor Morgan Freeman. It also featured a performance of a new tournament song called Dreamers featuring singer Jungkook of K-pop boy band BTS. Qatar is hosting and participating in a FIFA World Cup for the first time.

267.title: Video shows women in Rajasthan beating panchayat member for misbehaving
267.article_body: A video showing women beating a panchayat member with sticks in Rajasthan's Bharatpur for misbehaving with them has surfaced. Panchayat members had arrived at the scene to solve a land dispute and allegedly display their authority. The Panchayat Samiti member, Rohtash Meena, was beaten by women while other villagers tried to stop them. The women also tore Meena's clothes.

268.title: Woman killed, 2 injured as elephant demolishes house in Tamil Nadu
268.article_body: A 58-year-old woman was killed and two others were injured after an elephant demolished their house in Tamil Nadu's Gudalur, forest officials said on Sunday. The incident took place around midnight on Saturday when the animal strayed into the human habitat while looking for food. Officials added that they are trying to drive the elephant back into the forest.

269.title: Centre appoints 10 new Executive Directors for public sector banks
269.article_body: The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet has approved the appointment of ten Executive Directors (ED) in various Public Sector Banks. Lalit Tyagi, Chief General Manager of Bank of Baroda, has been appointed as ED of the same bank for three years. Punjab National Bank's Binod Kumar has been named the ED for the same bank for three years as well.

270.title: Air India allows crew to extend tenure under voluntary retirement
270.article_body: Tata Group-owned Air India has given its employees, including the cabin crew who opted for the voluntary retirement scheme (VRS), the option to extend their tenure until January 31, 2023 amid reports of shortage of staff. The release date for those who had opted for the VRS was November 30, 2022. Reportedly, 4,500 staff had applied for the scheme.

271.title: JP Nadda holds roadshow in Delhi, says 'people are tired of AAP govt'
271.article_body: Ahead of the MCD elections in Delhi, BJP's National President JP Nadda on Sunday held a roadshow in the national capital. "The people of Delhi are tired of the Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government. It's a government which is drowned in corruption," Nadda said during the roadshow. "The number of people gathered here indicates that BJP will be blessed," he added.

272.title: 'Modi-Modi' chants raised during Kejriwal's roadshow in Gujarat
272.article_body: A group of people raised 'Modi-Modi' slogans during Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's roadshow in Gujarat's Panchmahals on Sunday ahead of the Assembly elections. Kejriwal said, "I would like to tell them that you may shout slogans in support of whoever you want, but it's Kejriwal who will make schools for your children." He added that AAP will win their hearts.

273.title: Twitter Head of US Content Partnerships quits, says 'damn we had it good'
273.article_body: Twitter's Head of US Content Partnerships Sarah Rosen is the latest executive to announce her exit from the company after Elon Musk took over. "Took me a few days to come to terms with saying goodbye to 8.5 years at Twitter," said Rosen. She added, "Hot damn we had it good at Twitter 1.0."

274.title: It's an emotion, a blessing: Rishab on Daiva Kola scream from Kantara
274.article_body: Speaking about the scream of Daiva Kola from 'Kantara', actor Rishab Shetty said it's a real thing that happens in their kola. "It's not just a scream...It's a verdict, it's an emotion so it's a blessing," he added. Rishab stated, "I witnessed...that power of nature enters inside a human body...what happens after that is the reaction I tried to recreate."

275.title: 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli attends Governors Awards in Los Angeles
275.article_body: 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli attended the Governors Awards in Los Angeles, a precursor event to the Oscars where celebrities receive honorary statuettes. The film, which grossed over ₹1000 crore globally, featured Jr NTR and Ram Charan among others in pivotal roles. 'RRR'  also won the Best International Film award at the Saturn Awards 2022.

276.title: India doesn't need Aftab, but a leader like PM Modi: Assam CM
276.article_body: Reacting to the murder of Shraddha Walkar by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawala in Delhi, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said, "Our country doesn't need Aftab, but a person like Lord Ram [and]...leader like PM Narendra Modi." "We need Uniform Civil Code and law against love jihad. We need such laws where Aftabs can be hanged to death," he added.

277.title: Macron accuses Russia of spreading anti-French propaganda in Africa
277.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Sunday accused Russia of spreading anti-French propaganda in Africa to serve "predatory" ambitions in troubled African nations. The "perception" that France exploits its former colonies in Africa to serve its own interests was "fed by others" as part of a "political project", Macron told TV5 Monde. "Many influencers...are paid by the Russians," he added.

278.title: Met an Australian minister, he said he really liked 'RRR': Anurag Thakur
278.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur revealed that he recently met an Australian minister, who praised SS Rajamouli's film 'RRR' and said that he really liked the film. "It feels so good to see how the film is now hailed as an international film. RRR not only did the business but also showed the real abilities of Indian cinema," Thakur further added.

279.title: Verstappen wins season-closing Abu Dhabi GP, Vettel finishes 10th in career's last F1 race
279.article_body: Red Bull driver Max Verstappen won the Formula One 2022 season-closing Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. Ferrari driver Charles Leclerc finished second, while Red Bull driver Sergio Perez finished third. Meanwhile, Aston Martin driver and four-time world champion Sebastian Vettel finished 10th in his career's last race. Verstappen won the 2022 season with 454 points.

280.title: Shivaji an idol, hero till sun & moon exist: Fadnavis amid controversy
280.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj will remain a hero and idol as long as the sun and moon exist. "I feel there is no other role model than that of Shivaji Maharaj in the country," he added. His comments come after Governor BS Koshyari said Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj is an idol of "olden times".

281.title: Mangaluru blast suspect identified, was previously booked under UAPA
281.article_body: The prime suspect in the Mangaluru auto-rickshaw blast case has been identified as Mohammed Shariq from Karnataka's Shivamogga, police said. Shariq had previously been booked under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) for painting a pro-terrorism graffiti on a wall in Mangaluru and was out on bail. He was also absconding in a terror case and was wanted by police.

282.title: Indian fugitive Zakir Naik to preach Islamic sermons at 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar
282.article_body: Islamic preacher Zakir Naik, who's wanted in India over allegations of terror-related activities and inciting hate speeches, has arrived in Qatar for 2022 FIFA World Cup. He'll preach Islamic sermons throughout the tournament, Faisal Alhajri, a presenter at Qatari state-owned sports channel Alkass tweeted. Several videos on social media showed Naik walking into a venue, flanked by volunteers.

283.title: Parts of skull, jaw found by team searching for Shraddha's remains in Delhi forest
283.article_body: Parts of a skull, jaw and other bones were found by a team looking for remains of Shraddha Walkar in Delhi's Mehrauli forest on Sunday, multiple reports said citing police sources. The same will be sent for forensic examination, reports added. Walkar's live-in partner Aftab has reportedly confessed to killing her and concealing the evidence.

284.title: 6th shooter in Dera follower murder case held after encounter in Raj
284.article_body: A suspected shooter involved in the murder of a Dera Sacha Sauda follower was arrested following a brief encounter in a joint operation by Punjab and Rajasthan police in Jaipur on Sunday, officials said. According to police, the main shooter, identified as Ramjan Khan alias Raj Hooda, was injured in his leg in the shoot-out.

285.title: Aditya Chopra took chance on me, said 'I found my next SRK': Ranveer Singh
285.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who won the 'Superstar of the Decade' award at the Filmfare Middle East Awards, dedicated his award to producer Aditya Chopra. "He took a chance on me when no one did and said 'I found my next Shah Rukh Khan'," he stated. Ranveer made his debut in 'Band Baaja Baraat', which was produced by Yash Raj Films.

286.title: Kareena wraps up shooting for Hansal Mehta's next, shares post
286.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has completed shooting for an upcoming film, which is being directed by Hansal Mehta. She took to Instagram to share some pictures from the set and wrote, "As they say it's the journey never the destination...make it worthwhile." In a picture, Kareena could be seen posing with a clapboard with "Best Team Ever" written on it.

287.title: Village head cuts birthday cake with illegal pistol in MP; booked
287.article_body: A village sarpanch has been booked in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind for allegedly cutting a cake with a country-made pistol during a birthday celebration in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district. He allegedly live-streamed the celebrations on Facebook. Police have also registered a case against two other accused.

288.title: There is no prospect of recession in India: Ex-NITI Aayog VC
288.article_body: NITI Aayog's ex-Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar has said there's a synchronised downturn in US, Europe, Japan and China and that could take the global economy into a recession. He, however, added, "[There's] no such prospect of recession in India because although our growth may be negatively affected by the global conditions, we'll still manage to grow at 6-7% in 2023-24."

289.title: Experts warn of eruption as Russian volcano shows increased activity
289.article_body: The Shiveluch volcano on Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula has become extremely active and a powerful eruption can happen at any time, the Kamchatka Volcanic Eruption Response Team said on Sunday. "A growth of the lava dome continues..., explosions, and hot avalanches accompanies (sic) this process," the observatory added. "Ash explosions up to 10-15kms...could occur at any time," it warned.

290.title: Deadpool Christmas film got lost as Disney acquired Fox: Ryan Reynolds
290.article_body: Actor Ryan Reynolds revealed that he along with 'Deadpool' co-writers Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick wrote a Christmas movie featuring Deadpool four years ago. "But it got lost in the shuffle of Disney acquiring Fox and it never got made," he added. Ryan recently announced the third instalment of the 'Deadpool' franchise with Hugh Jackman.

291.title: 12 hurt, 50 houses gutted as fire breaks out in slum in West Bengal
291.article_body: At least 12 people sustained injuries and around 50 houses were gutted after a fire broke out in a slum in West Bengal's Siliguri, officials said on Sunday. Three of the injured persons, including a firefighter and a child, are undergoing treatment in a hospital, officials added. Eight fire tenders were pressed into service to douse the flames.

292.title: Williamson's future looks slightly uncertain in NZ's T20I team: Aakash
292.article_body: Aakash Chopra stated that Kane Williamson's future looks slightly uncertain in New Zealand's T20I team, although the captain has said that he'll play all three formats. "This country might not have that much batting depth...but T20 cricket is continuously asking him tough questions. Once in a while he plays a good knock but doesn't really change the world," he added.

293.title: Pakistani actor Fahad Mustafa touches Govinda's feet at an event in Dubai, video viral
293.article_body: During Filmfare Middle East Achievers Night 2022 in Dubai, Pakistani actor Fahad Mustafa touched Govinda's feet. A video of the same has gone viral. Before his gesture, Mustafa said on stage, "I started acting in the first place because of Govinda sir." He added, "I hope Pakistan and India once again come together to do good work."

294.title: You're supposed to show strength but we're not machines: Federer
294.article_body: Former world number one tennis player, Roger Federer, spoke on the issue of the mental health of contemporary athletes. "You're supposed to show strength. But we're not machines, we're human beings," Federer said. "The tour is tough...the travel, the practice, the jetlag. Nobody is allowed to say, 'I'm tired today,' because it looks like you're weak," he added.

295.title: Who's 'merchant of death' Viktor Bout whom Russia wants in exchange for US' Griner?
295.article_body: Russia is hoping to swap arms trafficker Viktor Bout, known as the 'merchant of death', in exchange for American WNBA player Brittney Griner. The Russian, who's serving a 25-year prison sentence in the US, had the capacity to 'transport weapons virtually anywhere in the world'. He was arrested after being lured into a trap in Thailand by US DEA agents.

296.title: Which are the top 10 ranked football teams ahead of 2022 FIFA World Cup?
296.article_body: As per the latest FIFA rankings ahead of 2022 FIFA World Cup, Brazil are the top-ranked team, followed by Belgium, Argentina, France and England. Italy, who failed to qualify for the Qatar World Cup, are ranked sixth. Spain are ranked seventh, followed by Netherlands, Portugal and Denmark.

297.title: Parading employees naked makes it easy for them to pee on you: Anupam to Musk
297.article_body: Shaadi.com Founder and Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal tweeted, "As smart as he is, why does Elon Musk fail to understand that if you parade subordinates naked in townhall, it makes it easy for them to pee on you in public." He added, "Respect is a two-way street, isn't it?" Musk sacked Twitter's 50% workforce after taking it over.

298.title: Students fire several rounds at Patna University after student body polls
298.article_body: A group of students fired several rounds at Patna University on Saturday after the student union elections. Police were deployed at the university to maintain law and order in the area. The Janata Dal (United) swept the Patna University Students' Union (PUSU) election by winning four out of five seats.

299.title: EPFO adds 16.82 lakh members in Sept, posts 9% YoY rise
299.article_body: Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) added 16.82 lakh members in September 2022, marking an increase of 9.14% as compared to the year-ago period, Labour Ministry data showed. Of the total additions, around 9.34 lakh members have come under the coverage of EPFO for the first time. About 58.75% of the new members are from the age group of 18-25 years.

300.title: Govt mulling to remove penal offences covered under IPC from GST law: Report
300.article_body: The government is considering to remove the penal offences which are already covered under the Indian Penal Code from the GST Act to make it more taxpayer-friendly, report said. The amendments would be placed before the GST Council for approval, before going to Parliament for effecting changes. Once approved, states would be required to amend their state GST laws.

301.title: It's a gateway for the world to know the real me: Bhavana on 'Fabulous...'
301.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Bhavana Pandey spoke about how her life has changed after the show. "Earlier, I was...celebrated as a wife and mother...but today people know me as Bhavana and have wonderful things to say," she said, adding, "Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives isn't just a show but a gateway for...world to know the real me."

302.title: Had my gameplan, it worked well: Suryakumar on his 111* in 2nd T20I
302.article_body: After India won their second T20I by 65 runs against New Zealand, India batter Suryakumar Yadav, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 51-ball 111*, said he had a clear plan when he went to bat. "I feel that I didn't think too much about what was happening. Just had my gameplan and it worked well," he added.

303.title: 'Depressed' man dies by suicide in Mumbai after friend's death
303.article_body: A 42-year-old man died by hanging himself from the ceiling fan at his residence in Mulund, Mumbai on Saturday. The deceased, Mayur Thakkar-Khant, was in depression over the death of his close friend, Nilesh Mali, who died 12 days ago, police said. The incident happened when Mayur's wife and their son were not present at the residence, police added.

304.title: Moody's to shut its consulting business in China, lay off staff: Report
304.article_body: Global credit rating agency Moody's Corporation is shutting down its consulting business in China and laying off staff across multiple locations across the country, Reuters reported. The layoffs will reportedly affect over 100 employees in Beijing, Shanghai and Shenzhen offices. Recently, Moody's said it was taking measures to align its global workforce with the current economic conditions.

305.title: 2 die, 7 hospitalised as workers in Shimla burn coal in room amid cold
305.article_body: Two labourers died and seven others were hospitalised after they burnt coal inside a room to cope with the cold in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla, police said on Sunday. As per reports, the gas formation combined with the lack of air inside the room led to suffocation. Local villagers, who opened the door later, found all the labourers unconscious.

306.title: A top critic was after my blood, he used to call me 'wooden': Suniel Shetty
306.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty in a recent interview opened up about how a "top critic" used to criticise him. "[He] was after my blood. He used to ridicule me very often, [call] me wooden and insist that I should go back to...restaurant business," he said. "It hurt...But one day...I realised...this guy must be having a personal grudge against me," Suniel added.

307.title: Licious not planning IPO before 2025-26: Co-founder Vivek Gupta
307.article_body: Online meat delivery unicorn Licious' Co-founder Vivek Gupta said that the company is not planning an initial public offering (IPO) before 2025-26 despite expecting its revenue to cross the ₹1,500 crore mark in 12 months. "We need to be EBITDA profitable and I will not take this company public before we start generating cash profit," Gupta added.

308.title: 1 dead, 4 injured after students crash car into bus near Hyderabad
308.article_body: One person died and four others were injured after six engineering students crashed their car into a stationary bus on National Highway- 65 at Isnapur near Hyderabad. The students were reportedly returning to Hyderabad from a road trip to Goa. A report claimed there were three rash driving challans pending against the speeding car in Siddipet and Warangal districts.

309.title: 1.9 kg of heroin hidden inside carton box seized at B'luru airport; 1 held
309.article_body: Customs officials on Friday arrested a man at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport for allegedly carrying 1.9 kg of heroin concealed inside the layers of a carton box that he carried as check-in baggage. The man was produced before a magistrate and remanded to judicial custody. He was travelling from Ethiopia's Addis Ababa to Bengaluru.

310.title: Former Congress MP Mahabal Mishra joins AAP ahead of MCD polls
310.article_body: Former MP and Congress leader Mahabal Mishra on Sunday joined AAP ahead of the Delhi Municipal Corporation election. He joined the AAP in the presence of AAP National Convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal during his public rally in Paharganj. Mahabal Mishra's son Vinay Mishra is an Aam Aadmi Party MLA from Dwarka.

311.title: Ranveer breaks down while recalling his struggle during award show in Dubai, video viral
311.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh broke down while recalling his struggle during Filmfare Middle East Achievers Night 2022 award show in Dubai. In a video that went viral, Ranveer, after receiving an award, can be heard saying, "The portfolio would cost ₹50,000, which I thought was a lot, but my father asked me not to worry and said he will help me."

312.title: Security forces detect 120 IEDs planted by Maoists in Jharkhand
312.article_body: Security forces engaged in anti-Naxal operation detected 120 improvised explosive devices (IED) planted by Maoists in Jharkhand's Latehar district, police said. The IEDs have been defused, police added. Security forces on Thursday detected and seized a 15-kg cooker bomb, a claymore mine, three detonators, a Motorola wireless set, two ammunition pouches and Naxal literature in Latehar and Garhwa.

313.title: ₹16,328-cr Phase 3 project of B'luru metro gets state govt's approval
313.article_body: Karnataka government on Friday approved the ₹16,328-crore Phase 3 project of Bengaluru's Namma Metro. "By 2041, Bengaluru will have 314 km of metro rail," Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation MD Anjum Parwez said. Phase 3 will have two corridors-one along Outer Ring Road, with 22 stations covering 32.15 km, and the other via Magadi Road, with nine stations covering 12.5 km.

314.title: Fireball flashes across the night sky in Canada; video surfaces
314.article_body: A fireball was seen flying across the night sky in Ontario, Canada, on November 19. Sharing a video of the event, the European Space Agency (ESA) said that the approximately 1-metre space object struck Earth over Canada, creating a "stunning fireball". The meteor was the only sixth object detected in space before striking Earth, the ESA added.

315.title: Shaheen Afridi undergoes appendectomy, shares pic from hospital
315.article_body: Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi took to Twitter to reveal that he underwent appendectomy on Sunday. Sharing a picture from hospital, Shaheen wrote, "Had an appendectomy today but Alhumdulillah feeling better. Remember me in your prayers." Earlier, Shaheen had suffered a knee injury during the final of T20 World Cup 2022.

316.title: Can't get any better than this: Hardik on India's 65-run win in 2nd T20I
316.article_body: Following India's 65-run win against New Zealand in second T20I, India captain Hardik Pandya said, "Can't get any better than this." He added, "Everyone chipped it but it was surely a special innings by Suryakumar Yadav...Bowlers did well and everyone had an aggressive mindset." Chasing 192, New Zealand were bowled out for 126 in 18.5 overs.

317.title: Cristiano Ronaldo is in spectacular form: Portugal WC squad member
317.article_body: Portugal team's footballer Ruben Neves said that his colleague Cristiano Ronaldo is in spectacular form ahead of the FIFA World Cup in Qatar. "He (Ronaldo) doesn't worry us at all, we as a team know perfectly well what we need to work on...If we're good as a team, Cristiano will be phenomenal," 25-year-old Neves said.

318.title: Tabu single-handledly saving Bollywood: Kangana Ranaut on 'Drishyam 2'
318.article_body: On Instagram Stories, Kangana Ranaut wrote  'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Drishyam 2' have been the only two Bollywood films that have been successful this year and both these films featured Tabu. "[Tabu is] single-handledly saving the Hindi film industry...Her talent...consistency have never been questioned, but to...reach the peak of her stardom in her 50s is commendable," she added.

319.title: Father held for rape of Pune girl; search on for grandfather, uncle
319.article_body: Pune Police have arrested the father of a 17-year-old girl, who was allegedly raped and sexually abused by him, her grandfather and uncle multiple times over the past six years. Further, police have sent a team to UP to arrest her grandfather and uncle. She made the revelation before a committee on sexual harassment at her college in the city.

320.title: 10 men, 9 women lashed 39 times for adultery & theft in Afghanistan
320.article_body: A Supreme Court official Abdul Rahim Rashid said on Sunday that 19 people, including 10 men and nine women, were lashed for adultery, theft and running away from home in northeastern Afghanistan on November 11. On Thursday, a Taliban spokesperson said they are committed to implementing all Sharia laws. Rahim said the 19 people were lashed 39 times each.

321.title: Truck crashes during Christmas parade in US, kills girl
321.article_body: A girl was killed after being hit by a truck that crashed while pulling a float at a Christmas parade in the US city of Raleigh, North Carolina on Saturday. The driver who lost control of the vehicle has been charged with reckless driving and other offences, the police said. The victim was also reportedly a part of the event.

322.title: Test cricket always first, far above ODIs and T20Is: Starc
322.article_body: Australia pacer Mitchell Starc said that for him, Test cricket is always first priority. "Tests...far above white-ball [cricket]...I would love to...continue playing Test cricket as long as I can," Starc said. He added, "It's certainly impossible...to play every game as a three-format player. We've seen that...sometimes there are two Australian teams playing at the same time."

323.title: Working on slower ones, yorkers for T20 cricket: Umran Malik
323.article_body: Team India pacer Umran Malik said that he is working on developing new deliveries for T20 cricket. "I am working on slowers and yorkers for T20s. Also, I am working very well on pitching good-length and hard-length balls,'' Malik said. The 22-year-old added, "I have to bowl fast, but I will also bowl with the variations."

324.title: This loss is so personal: Suniel Shetty pens note after Tabassum's death
324.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty took to social media to pen a note on veteran actress Tabassum following her demise. "This loss is so personal," he wrote with a broken heart emoji. "My love for acting & cinema stemmed from her Phool Khile Hain Gulshan Gulshan. Rest in Peace Tabassum Ji. You will be missed so much," Suniel added.

325.title: Teachers condemn Jamia dissolving JTA, suspension of professor
325.article_body: Jamia Millia Islamia teachers have condemned the university for dissolving the Jamia Teachers' Association (JTA) and suspending Professor Sonya Surabhi Gupta after she notified to conduct the teachers' association election without permission. The now-dissolved JTA called a meeting to discuss the issue, however, the administration alleged that it would disrupt the university's smooth functioning.

326.title: Govt to issue framework against fake reviews on e-commerce sites next week
326.article_body: Consumer Affairs Secretary Rohit Kumar Singh said the government will release frameworks to counter fake reviews and unverified star ratings on e-commerce websites and hotel and travel booking platforms next week. He mentioned that the Bureau of Indian Standards has also come out with a standard. "Initially, it will be voluntary and gradually will be made mandatory," he added.

327.title: Chiranjeevi & Anil dance at 1980s reunion party, Anupam shares video
327.article_body: Anupam Kher has shared a video from a reunion bash, which was hosted by Jackie Shroff and Poonam Dhillon last week in Mumbai. A part of the video showed actors Anil Kapoor and Chiranjeevi dancing at the party. Several 1980s actors from the Indian film industry, including Meenakshi Seshadri, Sarathkumar, Khushboo and Ramya Krishnan, attended the reunion.

328.title: 77-yr-old Mumbai woman loses ₹3.14 cr in share trading; 1 arrested
328.article_body: A 77-year-old woman was allegedly cheated of ₹3.14 crore by a share trading agent in Mumbai. The victim, Celino Pinto, lost her money after the accused, Naresh Bharat Singh, diverted her funds to a fake Demat account, police said. Pinto is a resident of Shimpoli in Borivali West while Naresh is from Delhi and has been arrested by the police.

329.title: Deepak Hooda records best-ever T20I bowling figures by an Indian in New Zealand
329.article_body: Team India all-rounder Deepak Hooda on Sunday recorded the best-ever bowling figures by an Indian in T20I cricket on New Zealand soil. The 27-year-old registered figures of 2.5-0-10-4 in the second T20I against New Zealand in Mount Maunganui to set the record. The previous record was set by Jasprit Bumrah (4.0-1-12-3) in 2020.

330.title: Akhilesh Yadav touches his uncle Shivpal's feet at poll rally in Mainpuri
330.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday touched his uncle Shivpal Yadav's feet while campaigning for the Lok Sabha by-poll in UP's Mainpuri. In a video, he can be seen greeting his uncle, touching his feet and then greeting the crowd. Notably, Akhilesh Yadav's wife Dimple Yadav will contest from Mainpuri seat, which fell vacant following Mulayam Singh Yadav's demise.

331.title: Police looking for Shraddha's head pump out water from a pond in Delhi
331.article_body: Police and municipal workers on Sunday pumped out water from a pond in Delhi's Mehrauli area in search of the head of Shraddha Walker, who was murdered and cut into 35 pieces by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawalla. Aftab reportedly told the investigating team that he dumped Shraddha's dismembered head in a pond. Aftab's five-day police custody ends on Tuesday.

332.title: Jyotika joins Rajkummar Rao's 'SRI', her first Hindi film in 21 yrs
332.article_body: Tamil actress Jyotika has signed her first Hindi film in 21 years. She will feature in Rajkummar Rao-starrer 'SRI', which is a biopic on industrialist Srikanth Bolla. Earlier, Jyotika featured in 'Doli Saja Ke Rakhna' (1998) and the trilingual film 'Little John' (2001). 'SRI', which will also star Alaya F in a pivotal role, will be helmed by Tushar Hiranandani.

333.title: US bishop accused of sexual abuse asks to be removed from priesthood
333.article_body: Howard Hubbard, a retired US bishop who has admitted to shielding priests facing sexual misconduct allegations and has himself been accused of sexual abuse, has asked Pope Francis to remove him from the priesthood. Hubbard said he wanted to be laicized because he could no longer function as a priest, given US church policy that bars accused priests from ministry.

334.title: Was waiting for something that wasn’t trying to be 'Golmaal': Tusshar
334.article_body: Tusshar Kapoor said that he was "waiting for something that's not trying to be another 'Golmaal'" and wanted to do something, which was "against" his on-screen image. Speaking about his upcoming project 'Maarrich', Tusshar said he has moved out of his comfort zone with this film. "It's been a while since I played a character that is grey," he added.

335.title: Future of social media doesn't have to belong to a billionaire: Mastodon
335.article_body: Twitter's rival platform Mastodon in a tweet said, "The future of social media doesn't have to belong to a billionaire, it can be in the hands of its users." Mastodon, which is increasingly being used by people after Twitter's acquisition by Elon Musk, just passed over 2 million active monthly users, setting a new record for the company.

336.title: 5 killed, 18 injured in shooting at gay nightclub in US
336.article_body: Five people were killed and 18 injured in shooting at a gay nightclub on Saturday night in US' Colorado Springs. A suspect was in custody and was being treated for injuries after the attack at Club Q. In a statement, Club Q said it was "devastated by senseless attack on our community" and offered condolences to victims and their families.

337.title: Malaysia gets hung Parliament for 1st time in history
337.article_body: Malaysia's general elections ended in a hung Parliament with the alliance led by long-time Opposition leader Anwar Ibrahim getting the maximum number of seats. His alliance was followed by the one led by former PM Muhyiddin Yassin. Reportedly, Malaysia's constitutional monarch may choose the PM. Notably, veteran leader Mahathir Mohamad lost an election for the first time in 53 years.

338.title: Turkish air raids hit Kurdish-held areas in northern Syria
338.article_body: Turkish air strikes hit several towns across northern Syria late Saturday, US-backed Kurdish-led forces said. Turkey targeted areas controlled by the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF), the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported. Syrian army troops and SDF fighters were reportedly among those killed. Ankara said it targeted bases from where militants staged attacks on Turkey.

339.title: Foreign investors buy Indian equities worth ₹30,385 cr in Nov so far
339.article_body: Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPI) have invested a net sum of ₹30,385 crore in equities during November 1-18, according to data with the depositories. The total outflow by FPIs in equities in 2022 stands at ₹1.4 lakh crore. On the other hand, foreign investors have pulled out ₹422 crore from the debt market during the period under review.

340.title: Cong has no moral grounds after aligning with Narmada activist: PM Modi
340.article_body: PM Narendra Modi criticised the Bharat Jodo Yatra for including activist Medha Patkar, who "stalled" the Narmada dam project "for three decades". "The Narmada project was the only solution to quench the thirst of the arid region of Kutch and Kathiyawad," he said. PM Modi urged Gujarat citizens to ask Congress on what "moral grounds" they are "seeking votes".

341.title: 64-yr-old railway doctor out for cycling dies as 4-wheeler crushes him in UP
341.article_body: A 64-year-old doctor at North Eastern Railway (NER) hospital was killed after a speeding four-wheeler crushed him near the 1090 crossing when he was out cycling. Police said that the deceased was a fitness enthusiast. The driver of the four-wheeler ran away from the scene. Some commuters informed the police about him.

342.title: 4 coal thieves killed, 2 injured in gunfight with CISF personnel in J’khand
342.article_body: At least four coal thieves were killed while two got injured during a gunfight with CISF personnel in Jharkhand’s Dhanbad, police said on Sunday. "The on-duty CISF personnel tried to stop coal thieves, who gathered in large numbers. However, when they attacked the jawans, a gunfight erupted in retaliation," Dhanbad SP (Rural), Reeshma Ramesan, said.

343.title: Mangaluru auto blast accused's Mysuru home raided, bomb squad deployed in area
343.article_body: The rented Mysuru home of the main accused in the Mangaluru autorickshaw blast incident was raided on Sunday, police said. According to reports, a bomb squad has been deployed for a combing operation in the area. DGP Praveen Sood said that the accused was carrying explosives and also had a fake or stolen Aadhaar card.

344.title: Tree branch falls on car during Formula E trials in Hyderabad; video surfaces
344.article_body: An accident was averted on Saturday after branch of a tree fell on one of the cars during the trial runs for Formula E race in Hyderabad. The incident occurred near Hyderabad's Prasads IMAX. The video of the incident went viral in which the branch can be seen falling on the racing car that lost control for a few seconds.

345.title: Bharat Jodo's positive energy undone by criticising Savarkar: Raut
345.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Sanjay Raut said that the positive energy generated due to the Congress's Bharat Jodo Yatra has been undone by Rahul Gandhi's criticism of VD Savarkar. Raut questioned why Gandhi was giving the BJP a chance to divert attention from the yatra. He also questioned why Savarkar has not gotten the Bharat Ratna yet.

346.title: Nepal’s missing rare white-rumped vulture found in Bihar
346.article_body: A missing white-rumped vulture, being used by Nepal to monitor the population of the rare endangered species and the success of a breeding drive, was rescued in Bihar’s Darbhanga earlier this month, officials said. The male vulture with a satellite tag had gone off the radar since April and was last sighted in Nepal's Tanahun district in September.

347.title: Actor Naga Shaurya marries interior designer Anusha Shetty, pics surface
347.article_body: Actor Naga Shaurya got married to interior designer Anusha Shetty in Bengaluru after reportedly dating for around two years. Pictures of the couple from their wedding have surfaced online. Shaurya and Anusha's pre-wedding celebrations had taken place at a Bengaluru hotel on Saturday. A grand reception will reportedly take place in Hyderabad later.

348.title: Guess 'helped themselves to my artwork without asking,' says Banksy; shares post
348.article_body: Graffiti artist Banksy has accused Guess of using his work without permission. Banksy wrote on Instagram, "Attention...shoplifters. Please go to Guess on Regent Street. They've helped themselves to my artwork without asking, how can it be wrong for you to do the same to their clothes?" Guess said its collection was in collaboration with Brandalised, which licenses graffiti artists' designs.

349.title: Parveen Babi resented my stardom in Italy, shares Kabir Bedi
349.article_body: Kabir Bedi said that while he "didn't bother" about actress Parveen Babi's stardom in India, she had "resentment" towards his stardom in Italy. "She wasn't used to being second fiddle to me. Suddenly, I was the star and she wasn't. This also upset her," he shared. Bedi rose to fame (in Italy) with his series 'Sandokan', which aired in 1976.

350.title: Was reluctant to do Aashiqui, saw how Devdas beat woman: Anu Aggarwal
350.article_body: Actress Anu Aggarwal, known for her role in 'Aashiqui', said that she was reluctant to do the 1990 film at first. "I was put off by the way...women were depicted in Hindi movies, way back in the 90s," she stated. "Like we were shown 'Devdas'...I saw how Devdas beats up a woman when she refuses to marry him," she added.

351.title: Make sure BJP wins each & every polling booth in Guj: PM to voters
351.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound Gujarat on Sunday, PM Narendra Modi urged the people to turn up in large numbers at their respective polling booths on the voting day and break all the previous records of voter turnout. "Another thing I want from you is to make sure the BJP wins each and every booth [in Gujarat]," PM Modi added.

352.title: 5 boys attack schoolgirl's father with iron rod in Pune; detained
352.article_body: Police have detained five minor boys for allegedly attacking the father of a girl student at a school with a sharp weapon and an iron rod in Pune's Lohegaon. The incident took place after the man approached and questioned the boys for allegedly passing comments and harassing people near the school. The victim suffered severe injuries in the incident.
