353.title: Want to see how much this Ishan-Pant opening pair gets backed by team: Nehra
353.article_body: Former India pacer Ashish Nehra has said he wants to see how much the team management will back the opening pair of Ishan Kishan and Rishabh Pant in T20Is. The duo opened India's batting in the second T20I against New Zealand. "I want to see what [India] do with their opening options, main thing is...they cannot be confused," added Nehra.

354.title: I felt like a zombie: Joe Root on why he quit as England Test captain
354.article_body: England batter Joe Root opened up on his decision to step down as England's Test captain earlier this year, revealing that he almost felt like a "zombie" and wasn't able to enjoy time with his family. "The captaincy was starting to take a toll on me," said Root. "As soon as I [quit]...I [felt] so much better," he further said.

355.title: Night sky has been lit up by Surya: Tendulkar on Suryakumar's 111*(51) vs NZ
355.article_body: Reacting to India batter Suryakumar Yadav's 51-ball 111* against New Zealand in second T20I, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "The night sky has been lit up by Surya! What a blinder." Mohammad Shami took to Twitter and wrote, "Congratulations for 111* (51)." It was Suryakumar's second T20I ton. India won the match by 65 runs. Suryakumar was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

356.title: Priyanka silent on Shraddha murder case to keep 'vote banks' safe: UP Dy CM
356.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya criticised Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi for her silence on the Shraddha Walkar murder case, saying she is keeping her "vote banks" safe. "Congress' Priyanka Gandhi says 'beti hun lad sakti hun' but has not spoken a word on this incident. Why is she silent?" said Maurya.

357.title: Zepto reports ₹390 crore loss in first year of operations
357.article_body: Quick-commerce startup Zepto has reported a loss of ₹390.4 crore in the first year of its operations on a standalone basis. In FY22, Zepto generated a total revenue of ₹142.4 crore, according to regulatory filings. Founded by Aadit Palicha and Kaivalya Vohra in April 2021, the Mumbai-based soonicorn is currently valued at $900 million.

358.title: BJP should remove Koshyari from Maha Guv's post as he insulted Shivaji: Raut
358.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Sanjay Raut criticised Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari for calling Shivaji Maharaj an 'old idol' and said that BJP should apologise to everyone and remove Koshyari from the post. "The Governor has insulted Shivaji Maharaj four times in one year. Still, the government is silent," said Raut.

359.title: Big B's 'angry young man' inspired my 'Kantara' role: Rishab
359.article_body: Actor Rishab Shetty has said he has been a fan of Amitabh Bachchan and added that he had watched several Bollywood films of the veteran actor. Speaking about his role in his film 'Kantara', Rishab added, "The 'angry young man' Amitabh was, that definitely was in Shiva (Rishab's character in 'Kantara')." Rishab has also directed and written 'Kantara'.

360.title: Mother Dairy hikes token milk price by ₹2/litre in Delhi-NCR
360.article_body: Mother Dairy has hiked the price of its token milk by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR citing a rise in input cost. The price of full-cream milk has been increased by ₹1 per litre. The latest hike in milk prices, the fourth this year by Mother Dairy, will come into effect on Monday, the company said.

361.title: My dear Bibing, stay young & fit always: Salman on Kiren Rijiju's b'day
361.article_body: Salman Khan took to Instagram to wish Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on his birthday. Sharing a picture with Rijiju, he wrote, "My dear Bibing, wishing you on your b'day abundance of love, health and happiness, stay young and fit always." On the work front, Salman will next be seen in 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan' and 'Tiger 3'.

362.title: Faulty signals under fire as 96 pedestrians die in Pune
362.article_body: In 2022, till October, there have been 96 pedestrian road crash deaths in Pune, according to Save Pune Traffic Movement (SPTM) which cited faulty pedestrian signals in the city as the reason behind these fatalities. Harshad Abhyankar, Director, SPTM, said that the PMC is not registering complaints. Shrinivas Kandul, head, PMC Electrical Department, said they will receive funds next month.

363.title: One of world's largest aircraft lands at Kolkata Airport; pics surface
363.article_body: One of the world’s largest aircraft Airbus Beluga made a landing at Kolkata Airport on Sunday for crew rest and refuelling. The Kolkata Airport authority shared pictures of the aircraft and wrote, "Guess who's back! It's the whale again!" This is the third time the aircraft visited Kolkata, the last being in May this year and before that in 1999.

364.title: COP27 ends in Egypt with decision to establish loss and damage fund
364.article_body: The UN Conference on Climate Change, COP27, concluded in Egypt on Sunday with a decision to establish a loss and damage fund to assist developing countries that are vulnerable to the adverse effects of climate change. "I welcome the decision to establish a loss and damage fund and to operationalise it in the coming period," UN Secretary-General António Guterres said.

365.title: Bankrupt FTX owes nearly $3.1 billion to its 50 biggest creditors
365.article_body: Collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX owes its 50 biggest creditors nearly $3.1 billion, revealed court filings. FTX, which filed for US bankruptcy court protection, said that it owes about $1.45 billion to its top ten creditors but didn't name them. On Saturday, FTX said that it is preparing for the sale or reorganisation of some businesses.

366.title: Former anti-abortion activist says key 2014 US SC ruling was leaked
366.article_body: A former anti-abortion activist has claimed he was informed in advance about the outcome of a 2014 US Supreme Court case involving contraceptives, The New York Times reported. Reverend Rob Schenck said he was tipped off about the pending ruling in the Burwell v. Hobby Lobby case shortly after two conservative allies had dinner at SC Justice Samuel Alito's home.

367.title: Had to leave 'Soldier' set for more than a week due to my exams: Preity
367.article_body: Preity Zinta in an Instagram post recalled shooting for her 1998 movie 'Soldier'. She said that she had to leave the set for more than a week while shooting for the climax scene due to her psychology exams. "Thank you Bobby (Deol) for being you & for bringing me into...movies & thank you to...entire...crew for so much fun," Preity added.

368.title: FIFA earns revenue of $7.5 bn for Qatar World Cup period
368.article_body: FIFA said that it has earned a revenue of $7.5 billion in the four years of commercial deals tied to the 2022 World Cup in Qatar. Qatar Energy joined FIFA as a top-tier sponsor, and new third-tier sponsors include Qatari bank QNB and telecoms firm Ooredoo. FIFA also added financial platform Crypto.com and blockchain provider Algorand as second-tier sponsors.

369.title: 4 big cranes, 400 workers deployed for dismantling of Mumbai's Carnac Bridge
369.article_body: Four big cranes and 400 workers have been deployed for the dismantling of Mumbai's Carnac Bridge, reports said. The 27-hour mega block in the city in view of the dismantling began on Saturday night. Central Railway took to Twitter to share a video of the ongoing dismantling process. Meanwhile, reports said that the bridge will be cut into 44 pieces.

370.title: India record their biggest-ever T20I victory on New Zealand soil
370.article_body: India defeated New Zealand by 65 runs in second T20I in Mount Maunganui on Sunday. It's India's biggest-ever victory (by runs) in T20I cricket on New Zealand soil. The match witnessed Suryakumar Yadav smash 111*(51), his second hundred in T20Is. India have taken a 1-0 lead in the three-match series. The first match was abandoned due to rain in Wellington.

371.title: 26-yr-old woman techie raped by man she met on matrimonial site in Pune
371.article_body: A 26-year-old woman, working for a multinational IT company in Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad, was allegedly raped by a man whom she met on a matrimonial website. She alleged that he raped her twice, promising that he would marry her and that they also held a pre-wedding tilak ceremony. The man has been identified as an IT engineer from UP's Prayagraj.

372.title: Faridabad policewoman arrested for receiving bribe to not book man for rape
372.article_body: Faridabad Police female constable was arrested for allegedly receiving a bribe from a man, who was booked for alleged dowry harassment, to not add rape sections to the FIR filed by his wife. The accused constable, Kalpana, had already received ₹20,000 from the man, Shabbir, and was demanding ₹15,000 more. Later, Kalpana was caught red-handed in a police laid-trap.

373.title: India break world record for playing most matches in a calendar year
373.article_body: Team India have broken the world record for playing the most number of matches in a calendar year. The second T20I against New Zealand on Sunday is India's 62nd international match in 2022. India overtook Australia, who had played 61 international matches in 2009. Further, it is India's 39th T20I match this year.

374.title: Didn't watch it but I'm sure it was another video game innings: Kohli on Suryakumar's 111*
374.article_body: Reacting to Suryakumar Yadav slamming 111*(51) against New Zealand in second T20I, Virat Kohli tweeted, "Numero Uno showing why he's the best in the world." He added, "Didn't watch it live...but I'm sure this was another video game innings by him." Suryakumar slammed 11 fours and seven sixes. Suryakumar is first Indian to slam a T20I hundred in New Zealand.

375.title: Rare bird spotted for the first time in 140 years on Fergusson Island; pic released
375.article_body: Scientists have 'rediscovered' the Black-naped Pheasant-Pigeon after spotting it some 140 years after its last sighting. The rare large, ground-dwelling pigeon, was photographed with a remote camera trap at the end of a month-long search of Fergusson Island in Papua New Guinea. Scientists hope the rare bird's rediscovery will provide a basis for its conservation.

376.title: Kajal reunites with Kamal Sadanah after 30 yrs for ‘Salaam Venky’
376.article_body: Bollywood actress Kajol will be seen sharing screen space with Kamal Sadanah after 30 years. Kajol and Kamal will be seen in Revathy's directorial venture 'Salaam Venky', which is set to release on December 9. Kajol and Kamal had earlier featured in the actress' Bollywood debut film 'Bekhudi' (1992). 'Salaam Venky' marks Kajol's first collaboration with Revathy.

377.title: Mahesh Bhatt, Denzongpa didn't object mention of Parveen Babi in my book: Kabir
377.article_body: Actor Kabir Bedi has revealed that filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt and actor Danny Denzongpa did not object to him writing about his and their relationships with late actress Parveen Babi in his autobiography. "What I wrote in the book is true and they (Mahesh and Danny) know it. There is nothing to hide here," he further added.

378.title: Veteran actor Amol Palekar, wife Sandhya join Cong’s Bharat Jodo Yatra
378.article_body: Veteran actor Amol Palekar and his wife writer-filmmaker Sandhya Gokhale joined Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra led by party leader Rahul Gandhi in Maharashtra’s Buldhana district on Sunday. "Realising his responsibility towards the country, today famous actor and film director Amol Palekar along with his wife joined Bharat Jodo Yatra…Thank you for raising the voice of the country," Congress tweeted.

379.title: Deloitte says India likely to post 6.5-7.1% growth in current fiscal
379.article_body: India is expected to post an economic growth of 6.5-7.1% during the current financial year and 5.5-6.1% the following year amid rising inflation and global slowdown, a Deloitte India report said. The report said the upcoming festive season could boost the consumer sector. Credit growth in the industry and services sector has also risen remarkably, the report added.

380.title: Suspects barge into village house near Greater Noida, fire several gunshots
380.article_body: A few people entered a house in Anandpur village near Greater Noida on Friday and allegedly fired three rounds of bullets to threaten the residents. The complainant, Sumit, alleged that the suspects assaulted his brother and elderly parents. The six accused are residents of the same village and have had a dispute with the complainant's family since 2019, police said.

381.title: Uttarakhand CM runs, plays badminton with people in Almora; video surfaces
381.article_body: A video has surfaced in which Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami can be seen running and playing badminton with young sports enthusiasts in Almora this morning. "I ran and played badminton…During this, feedback was also taken from young colleagues and local people about the work being done by the government," said Dhami.

382.title: World no. 4 Ruud beats Rublev to reach maiden final at ATP Finals
382.article_body: World number four Casper Ruud reached the title match of ATP Finals for the first time after a 6-2, 6-4 win over sixth-seeded Andrey Rublev in Turin on Saturday. The 23-year-old Norwegian won his semi-final match in 69 minutes. Ruud will face five-time champion Novak Djokovic on Sunday. He is 0-3 in head-to-head against the Serbian.

383.title: Lord Ram belongs to everyone, not just Hindus: Farooq Abdullah
383.article_body: Former J&K Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah warned people about political leaders who are attempting to create a religious divide in the valley, saying that Lord Ram belongs to everyone, not just Hindus. "They will use 'Hindu khatre mai hain' a lot during the elections...but I request you not fall prey to it," said Abdullah.

384.title: Girl chased by 3 dogs in Ghaziabad, narrowly escapes; video surfaces
384.article_body: An 11-year-old girl narrowly escaped being bitten by three stray dogs in Ghaziabad. In a CCTV footage of the incident, the girl can be seen running towards her society as the dogs aggressively chase her. Later in the video, one of the dogs was seen jumping and grabbing the girl's t-shirt, however, she managed to escape and enter the society.

385.title: I had strong opinions on being benched for T20 WC match vs Afghanistan: Starc
385.article_body: Australia pacer Mitchell Starc has revealed that he spoke to their chief selector George Bailey after being benched in their Super-12 stage match against Afghanistan in the recently concluded 2022 T20 World Cup. "I had strong opinions on it and had a conversation," said Starc. Australia had to defeat Afghanistan by a huge margin to qualify for the semi-finals.

386.title: Tim Southee becomes 2nd bowler to take a hat-trick against India in T20I cricket history
386.article_body: New Zealand pacer Tim Southee today became the second bowler to take a hat-trick against India in T20I cricket history. The 33-year-old dismissed Hardik Pandya, Deepak Hooda and Washington Sundar in India's last over in second T20I to take his second hat-trick in T20I cricket. Sri Lanka's Thisara Perera was the first bowler to take a T20I hat-trick against India.

387.title: We began with 2 people in 2018: Skyroot CEO after India's 1st private rocket launch
387.article_body: Pawan Kumar Chandana, the Co-founder and CEO of Hyderabad-based startup Skyroot Aerospace, shared a picture with his Co-founder Naga Bharath Daka on Twitter, and said, "I'd like to take a moment to remember our 'Prarambh' with just two people in 2018." His remark came after the startup's successful Mission Prarambh, marking the launch of India's first privately built rocket.

388.title: Is free electricity your right or revdi?: Kejriwal during MCD polls campaign
388.article_body: Campaigning for the upcoming MCD polls, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked people not to vote for those who want to stop the city’s development and welfare work. "Is free electricity your right or revdi? They want to stop free electricity in Delhi. But don’t worry, as long as Kejriwal is alive, electricity will be free," he said while addressing people.

389.title: 9 prisoners escape from Nagaland jail, massive search operation launched
389.article_body: At least nine inmates of Mon district jail in Nagaland escaped from prison following which a massive search operation is underway to trace them, police said on Sunday. The prisoners include under-trial inmates and murder convicts. They managed to escape in the early hours of Saturday after somehow getting hold of their cell keys, a police officer said.

390.title: Isha Ambani, husband Anand Piramal blessed with twins
390.article_body: Reliance Industries' Chairman Mukesh Ambani's daughter Isha Ambani and her husband Anand Piramal have been blessed with twins on Saturday, according to an official statement released by the Piramal and Ambani families. The statement further said that Isha and the babies, baby girl Aadiya and baby boy Krishna are doing well.

391.title: I've been dealing with different social issues through films: Ayushmann
391.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, who is UNICEF India's celebrity advocate, said he believes in cinema for change. Speaking about what motivated him to join UNICEF, he said, "I'm proud of my filmography as well as I've been dealing with different social issues through...entertainment." He added, "But, if I can do something outside the realm of cinema for the children, that's great."

392.title: Robotic surgery used to operate on 18-yr-old with ovarian cysts in Mohali
392.article_body: A Chandigarh-based 18-year-old girl, who had ovarian cysts, was operated on through a robotic surgery in Mohali. Dr Swapna Misra, Director of the Obstetrics and Gynaecology Department, said that so far, ovary removal was the standardised treatment for women having cysts around their ovaries. However, robotic surgery was used to preserve the young patient's organs.

393.title: When lawyers strike, consumers of justice suffer: CJI amid protest in Guj
393.article_body: Even as the Gujarat High Court Advocates' Association is protesting the transfer of Justice Nikhil S Kariel to Patna, CJI DY Chandrachud said people suffer when lawyers strike. "When lawyers strike, the greatest sufferers are not the lawyers themselves, or the judges, but the consumers of justice, for whom the lawyers exist in the first place," he said.

394.title: There is nothing from Pant's side, Urvashi just wants someone to tease her: Shubman Gill
394.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant-Urvashi Rautela controversy, Team India batter Shubman Gill stated that Pant doesn't get distracted by it. "There is nothing from Pant's side. Urvashi just wants someone to tease her," Gill stated. "He does not even care about it," Gill added referring to Urvashi's apparent social media posts on Rishabh Pant.

395.title: Why is 2022 FIFA World Cup official match ball named 'Al Rihla'?
395.article_body: The official match ball for 2022 FIFA World Cup is named 'Al Rihla'. It's inspired by culture, architecture, iconic boats and flag of Qatar, FIFA said. 'Al Rihla' in Arabic means 'the journey'. The bold, vibrant colours set on pearlescent background represent Qatar. 'Al Rihla' travels faster in flight than any other ball in FIFA World Cup history, FIFA stated.

396.title: Left home to go to Kashmir at 13, police brought me home: Deepti Naval
396.article_body: Actress Deepti Naval shared that at the age of 13, when she used to live in Amritsar, she decided to "leave home and live in Kashmir". "I was going to take a bus to Jammu...But I got caught at Pathankot. The police brought me back to my parents," Deepti said. She added, "A complaint was also lodged back in Amritsar."

397.title: Hyderabad Police to launch special campaign against wrong-side driving
397.article_body: The Hyderabad Police will undertake a week-long awareness drive from tomorrow (November 21) and will launch a special campaign on November 28 against wrong-side driving and tripling on motorcycles by imposing hefty fines. Those violating the wrong-side driving rule will now have to pay a fine of ₹1,700 against the current penalty of ₹1,100, the police said.

398.title: Pujara receives Arjuna Award 5 years after recommendation, shares pic
398.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara collected his Arjuna Award on Saturday, five years after he was recommended for the honour in 2017. Pujara took to Twitter to share pictures from the ceremony and wrote, "Thankful to BCCI and Anurag Thakur to organise and handover the Arjuna Award belatedly, which I couldn't collect the year it was awarded...due to my cricket commitments."

399.title: Musk holds 'code review' meeting with Twitter engineers till 1:30 am
399.article_body: Elon Musk held a 'code review' meeting with engineers at Twitter's San Francisco headquarters till 1:30 am. He also posted his pictures with the employees on Twitter. Responding to a tweet saying, "Twitter is more alive at 1 am than it used to be during the daytime," Musk responded, "The most people I've ever seen in the building by far."

400.title: If lawyers protest against collegium decisions, where will it lead?: Rijiju
400.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju criticised protests by lawyers against the recommendations of the Supreme Court collegium to transfer some High Court judges. "If this becomes a recurring instance...taken by the collegium, on which it's being supported by...government, then where will it lead," he asked. Recently, bar bodies in Gujarat, Telangana and Madras have protested the transfer decisions.

401.title: Pune records season's coldest morning on Sunday, temperature drops to 9.7°C
401.article_body: According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), Pune city on Sunday reported the coldest morning of the season when the temperature dropped to 9.7 degrees Celsius. Pune was cooler than Mahabaleshwar, Lonavala and Matheran this morning. Mahabaleshwar reported night temperature of 10.9 degrees Celsius, Lonavala 12.5 degrees Celsius and Matheran 17.2 degrees Celsius.

402.title: 7 suspended after filing independent nominations after not getting BJP tickets
402.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party has suspended seven people who had filed independent nominations for seats where the party did not allot them tickets for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. The BJP leaders, including a sitting MLA and four former legislators, had filed nominations on Thursday as independents after being denied tickets by the party.

403.title: Mercedes-Benz to pay $5.5 mn to settle Arizona diesel ad case
403.article_body: Mercedes-Benz and auto supplier Robert Bosch have agreed to pay about $6 million to resolve a lawsuit accusing them of approving and marketing BlueTEC vehicles as "the most environmentally conscious diesel option" globally, the state of Arizona said. The firm will pay $2.8 million in consumer restitution. Each qualifying Arizona consumer will receive up to $625 per vehicle.
